TEXT.Polish: Wojsko najemne (także: najemnicy, żołnierze najemni, kondotierzy,żołnierze fortuny) - formacja wojskowa składająca się z ochotników walczących za pieniądze, najczęściej w służbie obcego wojska dla danego państwa, miasta, władcy lub jakiejś organizacji, a nawet osoby prywatnej. Wojska te można wynająć do walki w praktycznie dowolnej sprawie, ponieważ te formacje nie kierują się idealizmem. W tym kontekście najemnicy to ludzie, dla których wojna jest zawodem, z którego czerpią środki do życia (żołd) i wzbogacenia się. Ważną rzeczą jest, aby daną formację określić mianem najemników, zasada dobrowolności służby i pobierania żołdu przez żołnierzy służących w takich oddziałach.

TEXT.English: Mercenary Stables
TEXT.Italian: Stalle dei mercenari
TEXT.Polish: Stajnie Najemników

TEXT.English: Build a Mercenary Stabes inorder to build a Bandit Rider.
TEXT.French: Augmente les revenus, mais également la criminalité de la ville. Permet de former des Bandits à cheval.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le stalle dei mercenari per poter addestrare i banditi a cavallo.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Mercenary Stabes inorder to build a Bandit Rider.

TEXT.English: Build a Mercenary Stabes inorder to build a Bandit Rider.
TEXT.French: permet de former des Bandits à cheval.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le stalle dei mercenari per poter addestrare i banditi a cavallo.
TEXT.Polish: Wojsko najemne (także: najemnicy, żołnierze najemni, kondotierzy,żołnierze fortuny) - formacja wojskowa składająca się z ochotników walczących za pieniądze, najczęściej w służbie obcego wojska dla danego państwa, miasta, władcy lub jakiejś organizacji, a nawet osoby prywatnej. Wojska te można wynająć do walki w praktycznie dowolnej sprawie, ponieważ te formacje nie kierują się idealizmem. W tym kontekście najemnicy to ludzie, dla których wojna jest zawodem, z którego czerpią środki do życia (żołd) i wzbogacenia się. Ważną rzeczą jest, aby daną formację określić mianem najemników, zasada dobrowolności służby i pobierania żołdu przez żołnierzy służących w takich oddziałach.

TEXT.English: Poacher's Camp
TEXT.German: Wildererlager
TEXT.Italian: Campo dei bracconieri
TEXT.Polish: Obóz Kłusowników

TEXT.English: Illegal hunting results in more Gold, Food, and instability.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Braconnage[COLOR_REVERT] illégal réalisé à travers ce bâtiment vous procurera de l'or, de la nourriture, mais augmentera forcément la criminalité et l'instabilité.
TEXT.Italian: Il bracconaggio fornisce cibo ed oro, ma aumenta l'instabilità.

TEXT.English: Poaching is the illegal hunting, fishing, trapping, or eating of wild plants or animals contrary to local and international conservation and wildlife management laws. Violations of hunting laws and regulations are normally punishable by law and, collectively, such violations are known as poaching.
TEXT.Italian: Il bracconaggio è la caccia, pesca, cattura o alimentazione illegale di piante o animali, in modo lesivo delle leggi locali o internazionali di conservazione di flora e fauna. Le violazioni delle leggi e delle regole di caccia sono solitamente punibili per legge; nell'immaginario collettivo, queste violazioni sono note come bracconaggio.
TEXT.Polish: Kłusownictwo - zabijanie, chwytanie lub ściganie zwierzyny oraz łowienie ryb z naruszeniem obowiązującego prawa, bez wymaganych uprawnień, w niedozwolony prawem sposób, a także w niedozwolonym czasie lub miejscu.

TEXT.English: Saloon
Build a Saloon to increase your cities culture and wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Saloon[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la culture et la richesse de vos villes.
TEXT.German: Errichte einen Saloon um Kultur und Reichtum in der Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un saloon per incrementare la cultura e la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Saloon by zwiększyć kulturę i bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A saloon is a kind of bar particular to the Old West. Saloons served such customers as fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, gold prospectors and miners, and gamblers.
TEXT.Italian: Un saloon era un bar tipico del Far West. I clienti dei saloon erano solitamente cacciatori di pelli, cowboy, soldati, cercatori d'oro, minatori e giocatori d'azzardo.
TEXT.Polish: Saloon (fr. salon, z łac. sala) - termin używany dla określenia pomieszczenia, gdzie sprzedawany jest w USA alkohol z przeznaczeniem do spożycia na miejscu. Saloon stanowi stereotypowy element filmów o Dzikim Zachodzie.

TEXT.English: Assassin's Den
TEXT.Italian: Covo deli assassini
TEXT.Polish: Kryjówka Zabójców

TEXT.English: Build an Assassin's Den to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un covo degli assassini per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Assassin's Den to increase your cities wealth.

TEXT.English: Assassination is one of the oldest tools of power politics. It dates back at least as far as recorded history.
TEXT.Italian: L'assassinio è uno degli strumenti politici più antichi; risale addirittura alla preistoria.
TEXT.Polish: Kryjówka płatnych morderców.

TEXT.English: Smuggler's Shanty
TEXT.Italian: Baracca del contrabbandiere
TEXT.Polish: Kryjówka Przemytników

TEXT.English: Build a Smuggler's Shanty to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una baracca del contrabbandiere per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Smuggler's Shanty by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Smuggling is the clandestine transportation of goods or persons past a point where prohibited, such as out of a building, into a prison, or across an international border, in violation of applicable laws or other regulations.
TEXT.Italian: Il contrabbando è il trasporto clandestino ed illegale di beni e persone oltre un certo punto, come fuori da un edificio, in una prigione o attraverso un confine internazionale, in violazione di leggi o altre regole.
TEXT.Polish: Przemyt (kontrabanda, pot. szmugiel) - przemieszczenie towarów pomiędzy państwami z pominięciem opłat celnych, akcyzy, podatku VAT i innychnależności wobec państwa, na którego terytorium wwieziono towar, lub też wwiezienie towaru, którym obrót jest w danym kraju zakazany przez prawo. Omija się również, rzadko co prawda występujące, opłaty i ograniczenia wywozowe.

TEXT.English: Pirate's Cove
TEXT.Italian: Covo dei pirati
TEXT.Polish: Kryjówka Piratów

TEXT.English: Build a Pirate's Cove to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville, mais encourage la criminalité.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un covo dei pirati per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Pirate's Cove by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Ocean piracy, off the coasts of North America, continued as late as the 1870s. Pirates who operated in the Caribbean often sailed north to attack targets off the present day eastern seaboard of the United States. Possibly the most famous of these was Blackbeard, who operated in the American south, attacking ships and at one point even blockading Charleston, South Carolina.
TEXT.Italian: La pirateria al largo delle coste del Nordamerica continuò fino agli anni '70 dell'Ottocento. I pirati che operavano nei Caraibi facevano spesso rotta verso nord per attaccare le città dell'attuale costa est degli Stati Unitit. Il più famoso di essi fu Barbanera che fu attivo negli Stati Uniti meridionali, attaccando le navi e persino assediando Charleston, nel Sud-Carolina.
TEXT.Polish: Pirat - osoba, która napada w celu rabunkowym, używając statku lub łodzi. Piraci atakują zwykle inne statki, ale mogą również napadać cele nabrzeżne.

TEXT.English: Mob Storefront
TEXT.Italian: Vetrina per mafiosi
TEXT.Polish: Pralnia Mafii

TEXT.English: Build a Mob Storefront to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una vetrina per mafiosi per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Mob Storefront by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A gangster is a criminal who is a member of a gang. Some gangs are considered to be part of organized crime. Gangsters are also called mobsters.
TEXT.Italian: Un gangster è un criminale che fa parte di una gang; alcune gang fanno parte del crimine organizzato. A volte, i gangster vengono definiti mafiosi.
TEXT.Polish: Mafia - tajna sycylijska organizacja przestępcza z głównym ośrodkiem w Palermo; nazwa zorganizowanej grupy przestępczej o dużych wpływach, powiązaniach z osobami na różnych szczeblach władzy, policją, biznesem, prowadząca działalność gospodarczą finansowaną z przestępstw; używana przez media nazwa każdej zorganizowanej grupy przestępczej.

TEXT.English: Chop Shop
TEXT.Italian: Garage clandestino
TEXT.Polish: Warsztat-Dziupla

TEXT.English: Build a Chop Shop to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un garage clandestino per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Chop Shop by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Chop shop is a slang phrase with various uses including an illegal location or business which disassembles stolen automobiles for the purpose of selling them as parts.
TEXT.Italian: Un garage clandestino è un edificio commerciale illegale che smonta le automobili rubate con lo scopo di venderne i pezzi.
TEXT.Polish: Dziupla - potoczna nazwa miejsca, w którym dokonywany jest demontaż skradzionych pojazdów w celu sprzedania ich w częściach. Rzadziej używana jako określenie miejsca związanego ze sprzedażą kradzionych dóbr innych niż pojazdy, lub jako miejsce dezaktywacji urządzeń antywłamaniowych czy zmiany wyglądu pojazdów w celu zmniejszenie ryzyka wykrycia.

TEXT.English: Rebel Camp
TEXT.Italian: Campo dei ribelli
TEXT.Polish: Obóz Rebeliantów

TEXT.English: Build a Rebel Camp to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo dei ribelli per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Rebel Camp by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Rebellion, uprising or insurrection, is a refusal of obedience or order. It may, therefore, be seen as encompassing a range of behaviors aimed at destroying or replacing an established authority such as a government or a head of state. On the one hand the forms of behaviour can include non-violent methods such as the (overlapping but not quite identical) phenomena of civil disobedience, civil resistance and nonviolent resistance.
TEXT.Italian: Ribellioni, rivolte e insurrezioni sono tutti rifiuti di eseguire un ordine. Si possono pertanto considerare come una serie di comportamenti volti a distruggere o sostituire un autorità costituita, come un governo o un capo di stato. Da un lato le forme di comportamento possono includere metodi non violenti, come i fenomeni di disobbedienza civile (simili, ma non del tutto identici), di resistenza civile e di resistenza non violenta.
TEXT.Polish: Rebeliant - buntownik, powstaniec, członek oddziałów paramilitarnych, osoba występująca zbrojnie przeciwko obowiązującemu porządkowi. W historii wiele różnych grup było nazywanych rebeliantami, zwłaszcza podczas wojen. Różnica między rebeliantem a terrorystą jest subiektywna. Podczas gdy rebeliant posiada pewne pozytywne konotacje, terrorysta jest postrzegany wyłącznie destrukcyjnie.

TEXT.English: Druglord's Manson

French.Text: Manoir d'un Baron de la drogue

TEXT.Italian: Villa dei narcotrafficanti
TEXT.Polish: Rezydencja Barona Narkotykowego

TEXT.English: Build a Druglord's Manson to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una villa dei narcotrafficanti per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Druglord's Manson by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A drug lord, drug baron or kingpin is the term used to describe a person who controls a sizable network of persons involved in the illegal drugs trade. Such figures are often difficult to bring to justice, as they might never be directly in possession of something illegal, but are insulated from the actual trade in drugs by several layers of underlings. The prosecution of drug lords is therefore usually the result of carefully planned infiltrations of their networks, often using informants from within the organization.
TEXT.Italian: Un signore della droga è una persona che controlla una grande rete di persone dedite alla distribuzione illegale di droga. Queste persone vengono difficilmente incriminate, dato che non vengono mai trovate direttamente in possesso di qualcosa di illegale; sono infatti isolati dal commercio della droga da vari strati di dipendenti. L'incriminazione di un signore della droga avviene quindi come risultato di infiltrazioni pianificate all'interno delle loro reti, spesso usando informatori interni alle organizzazioni.
TEXT.Polish: Handel narkotykami w wielu krajach jest zabroniony. Odgrywa też nieprzeciętną rolę w prowadzeniu wojen lokalnych jak np. w Afganistanie przeciwko interwencji radzieckiej. Dostawy broni CIA dla powstańców afgańskich były opłacane przez nich przy pomocy opium. To doprowadziło do takiego rozwoju uprawy opium, że Afganistan stał się największym światowym producentem tego narkotyku.

TEXT.English: Terrorist's Compound
TEXT.Italian: Cellula di terroristi
TEXT.Polish: Obóz Terrorystów

TEXT.English: Build a Terrorist's Compound to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una cellula di terroristi per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Terrorist's Compound by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Common definitions of terrorism refer only to those violent acts which are intended to create fear (terror), are perpetrated for a religious, political or ideological goal, and deliberately target or disregard the safety of non-combatants (civilians).
TEXT.Italian: Le definizioni comuni di terrorismo si riferiscono solamente a quegli atti violenti volti a creare paure (terrore), che hanno scopi religiosi, politici o ideologici, e puntano deliberatamente a colpire i non combattenti (civili).
TEXT.Polish: Terroryzm - użycie siły lub przemocy psychicznej przeciwko osobom lub własności z pogwałceniem prawa, mające na celu zastraszenie i wymuszenie na danej grupie ludności lub państwie ustępstw w drodze do realizacji określonych celów. Działania terrorystyczne mogą dotyczyć całej populacji, jednak najczęściej są one uderzeniem w jej niewielką część, aby pozostałych obywateli zmusić do odpowiednich zachowań.

TEXT.English: Crime (Graffiti)
TEXT.French: Délit (Graffiti)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Graffiti)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Graffiti)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.

TEXT.English: Graffiti is writing or drawings scribbled, scratched, or sprayed illicitly on a wall or other surface in a public place.
TEXT.Italian: I graffiti comprendono scritte e disegni che vengono incisi, dipinti o spruzzati illegalmente su un muro o un'altra superficie pubblica.

TEXT.English: Crime (Poaching)
TEXT.French: Délit (Braconnage)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Bracconaggio)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kłusownictwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Poaching is the illegal taking of wild plants or animals contrary to local and international conservation and wildlife management laws. Violations of hunting laws and regulations are normally punishable by law and, collectively, such violations are known as poaching.
TEXT.Italian: Il bracconaggio è la caccia, pesca, cattura o alimentazione illegale di piante o animali, in modo lesivo delle leggi locali o internazionali di conservazione di flora e fauna. Le violazioni delle leggi e delle regole di caccia sono solitamente punibili per legge; nell'immaginario collettivo, queste violazioni sono note come bracconaggio.

TEXT.English: Crime (Soliciting)
TEXT.French: Délit (Solicitation)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Sollecitazioni)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Nagabywanie)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Literally, solicitation means: 'urgently asking'. It is the action or instance of soliciting; petition; proposal. In criminal law, it most commonly refers to either the act of offering goods or services, or the act of attempting to purchase such goods or services. Legal status may be specific to the time and/or place where solicitation occurs.
TEXT.Italian: Letteralmente, sollecitazione significa 'chiedere urgentemente'. E l'azione di sollecitazione, petizione o proposta. Nel diritto penale, si riferisce più comunemente sia all'atto di offrire beni o servizi, sia a quello di tentare di acquistare tali beni o servizi. Lo status giuridico può essere specifico per l'ora e/o il luogo in cui si verificano le sollecitazioni.

TEXT.English: Crime (Pickpocketing)
TEXT.French: Délit (Pickpocket)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Borseggiatori)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kieszonkowstwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Pickpocketing is a form of larceny that involves the stealing of money or other valuables from the person of a victim without their noticing the theft at the time. It requires considerable dexterity and a knack for misdirection. A thief who works in this manner is known as a pickpocket.
TEXT.Italian: Il borseggio è un tipo di furto che riguarda l'appropriazione indebita di denaro o oggetti di valore da una vittima, senza che questa noti il ladro al momento del furto; richiede una certa abilità e un certo talento nel depistaggio. Un ladro che svolge quest'attività è detto borseggiatore.

TEXT.English: Crime (Fighting)
TEXT.French: Crime (Combat urbain)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Combattimenti di strada)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Walki)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Combat, or fighting, is a purposeful violent conflict meant to establish dominance over the opposition, or to terminate the opposition forever, or drive the opposition away from a location where it is not wanted or needed.
TEXT.Italian: Il combattimento è un mezzo di opposizione violento attuato per stabilire il controllo sopra un gruppo di nemici, per eliminarli definitivamente o per allontanarli da un luogo dove non sono nè benvoluti, nè necessari.

TEXT.English: Crime (Car Theft)
TEXT.French: Délit (Vol de voitures)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Ladri di automobili)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kradzież samochodów)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Motor vehicle theft is the criminal act of stealing or attempting to steal a motor vehicle (such as an automobile, truck, bus, coach, motorcycle, snowmobile, trailer).
TEXT.Italian: Il furto di autoveicoli è l'atto illegale di rubare, o tentare di rubare, un veicolo a motore, come un'automobile, un camion, un bus, una moto, una motoslitta, un carro o un camper.

TEXT.English: Crime (Drugs)
TEXT.French: Délit (Consommation de drogues)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Spaccio di droga)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Narkotyki)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A drug, broadly speaking, is any substance that, when absorbed into the body of a living organism, alters normal bodily function.
TEXT.Italian: Una droga è qualunque sostanza che, quando viene assorbita nel corpo di un organismo vivente, altera le normali funzioni corporee.

TEXT.English: Crime (Mugging)
TEXT.French: Crime (Agression)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Aggressioni)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Rozbój)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Robbery is the crime of taking or attempting to take something of value by force or threat of force or by putting the victim in fear. At common law, robbery is defined as taking the property of another, with the intent to permanently deprive the person of that property, by means of force or fear.
TEXT.Italian: Un'aggressione è il crimine di prendere o tentare di prendere qualcosa di valore con la forza, con le minacce o terrorizzando la vittima. Nella legge comune, il furto è definito come l'appropriazione indebita di proprietà con l'intento di privare permanentemente quella persona di quella proprietà, per mezzo della forza o di minacce.

TEXT.English: Crime (Drunk Driving)
TEXT.French: Délit (Conduite en état d'ébriété)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Guida in stato d'ebbrezza)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Jazda po pijanemu)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Drunken Driving is the act of driving a motor vehicle with blood levels of alcohol in excess of a legal limit. Similar regulations cover driving or operating certain types of machinery while affected by drinking alcohol or taking other drugs. This is a criminal offense in most countries. Convictions do not necessarily involve actual driving of the vehicle.
TEXT.Italian: La guida in stato d'ebbrezza è l'atto di guidare un veicolo a motore avendo un tasso alcolemico superiore al limite legale; queste regole riguardano la guida di certi macchinari solo l'effetto di alcool o altre sostanze sufficienti. Questo è un reato penale nella maggior parte dei paesi. Le condanne non comportano necessariamente la guida effettiva del veicolo.

TEXT.English: Crime (Arson)
TEXT.French: Délit (Pyromane)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Piromani)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Podpalenia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Arson is the crime of intentionally or maliciously lighting structures, wildland areas, cars or other property on fire. It may be distinguished from other causes such as spontaneous combustion and natural wildfires. Arson often involves fires deliberately set to the property of another or to one's own property as to collect insurance compensation.
TEXT.Italian: I piromani sono persone che appiccano intenzionalmente il fuoco a strutture, aree selvatiche, veicoli o altre proprietà; è una cosa molto diversa dalle combustioni spontanee e dagli incendi naturali. Alcuni piromani appiccano volontariamente il fuoco alle proprie proprietà per poi intascare i premi delle assicurazioni.

TEXT.English: Crime (Bank Robbery)
TEXT.French: Crime (Attaque de Banque)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Rapine in banca)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Napady na bank)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Bank robbery is the crime of stealing from a bank during opening hours. According to the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Uniform Crime Reporting Program, robbery is the taking or attempting to take anything of value from the care, custody, or control of a person or persons by force or threat of force or violence and/or by putting the victim in fear.
TEXT.Italian: Una rapina in banca è un reato che consiste nel derubare una banca durante l'orario di apertura. Secondo le definizioni legali, la rapina è il prendere o il tentativo di prendere qualcosa di valore dalla cura, custodia o controllo di una o più persone con la forza, la minaccia della forza, la violenza e/o mettendo la vittima nella paura.

TEXT.English: Crime (Murder)
TEXT.French: Crime (Meurtre)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Omicidi)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Morderstwa)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Murder is the unlawful killing, with malice aforethought, of another human, and generally this state of mind distinguishes murder from other forms of unlawful homicide (such as manslaughter).
TEXT.Italian: L'omicidio è l'uccisione illegale e con premeditazione di un altro essere umano, e in generale questo stato d'animo distingue l'omicidio da altre forme di omicidi, come l'omicidio colposo).

TEXT.English: Crime (Organized Crime)
TEXT.French: Crime (Crime organisé)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Crimine organizzato)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przestępczość zorganizowana)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Organized crime or criminal organizations are transnational, national, or local groupings of highly centralized enterprises run by criminals for the purpose of engaging in illegal activity, most commonly for monetary profit. Some criminal organizations, such as terrorist organizations, are politically motivated. Sometimes criminal organizations force people to do business with them, as when a gang extorts money from shopkeepers for protection.
TEXT.Italian: Il crimine organizzato è costituito da organizzazioni locali, nazionali e internazionali composte da imprese altamente centralizzate che vengono gestite da criminali con lo scopo di intraprendere attività illegali, solitamente per ottenere un profitto economico. Alcune organizzazioni criminali hanno anche motivazioni politiche, come ad esempio le cellule terroristiche. Alcune volte le organizzazioni criminali costringono le persone a fare affari con loro, ad esempio quando estorcono il pizzo ai commercianti.

TEXT.English: Crime (Gangs)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Bande criminali)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Gangi)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A gang is a group of people who, through the organization, formation, and establishment of an assemblage, share a common identity.
TEXT.Italian: Una banda criminale è un gruppo di persone che condividono gli stessi ideali criminali attraverso l'organizzazione e formazione di una gang.

TEXT.English: Crime (Burglary)
TEXT.French: Crime (Cambriolage)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Furti con scasso)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Włamania)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Burglary is a crime, the essence of which is illicit entry into a building for the purposes of committing an offense. Usually that offense will be theft, but most jurisdictions specify others which fall within the ambit of burglary.
TEXT.Italian: L'essenza del furto con scasso è entrare illegalmente in un edificio con lo scopo di commettere un reato; solitamente questo reato è il furto, ma secondo le diverse giurisdizioni ci possono anche essere altre azioni criminali.

TEXT.English: Crime (Rape)
TEXT.French: Crime (Viol)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Violenza)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Gwałty)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent. A person who commits an act of rape is known as a rapist.
TEXT.Italian: Lo stupro è un tipo di violenza sessuale che di solito coinvolge il rapporto sessuale, iniziato da una o più persone nei confronti di un'altra persona senza il consenso di quest'ultima. Una persona che commette un atto di stupro è conosciuto come uno stupratore.

TEXT.English: Crime (Counterfeiting)
TEXT.French: Crime (Contrefaçon)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Contraffazione)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Fałszerstwa)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: To counterfeit means to illegally imitate something. Counterfeit products are often produced with the intent to take advantage of the superior value of the imitated product. The word counterfeit frequently describes both the forgeries of currency and documents, as well as the imitations of works of art, toys, clothing, software, pharmaceuticals, watches, electronics and company logos and brands.
TEXT.Italian: La contraffazione è l'atto di imitare illegalmente qualcosa; i prodotti contraffatti vengono spesso fatti con l'intento di ottenere vanataggi dal valore intrinseco superiore dei prodotti imitati. La contraffazione si riferisce a monete, documenti, pezzi d'arte, giocattoli, vestiti, software, farmaci, orologi, prodotti di elettronica e loghi di marche famose.

TEXT.English: Crime (Forgery)
TEXT.French: Crime (Contrefaçon)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Falsificazione)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Fałszowanie monet)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Forgery is the process of making, adapting, or imitating objects, statistics, or documents with the intent to deceive. Copies, studio replicas, and reproductions are not considered forgeries, though they may later become forgeries through knowing and willful misrepresentations.
TEXT.Italian: La falsificazione è il reato di fare, adattare o imitare oggetti, statistiche o documenti con lo scopo di ingannare qualcuno. Le copie, le repliche di studio e le riproduzioni non sono considerati falsi, anche se possono poi diventare falsificazioni attraverso la conoscenza e la volontaria travisazione.

TEXT.English: Tavern
TEXT.Italian: Taverna
TEXT.Polish: Tawerna

TEXT.English: Build a Tavern to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una taverna per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Tavern by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A tavern is a place of business where people gather to drink alcoholic beverages and be served food, and in some cases, where travelers receive lodging.
TEXT.Italian: Una taverna è un ocale in cui le persone si radunano per bere bevande alcoliche e per mangiare del cibo; in alcuni casi, le taverne offrono anche alloggio ai viaggiatori.
TEXT.Polish: Tawerna (wł. taverna, łac. taberna) - słowo to w podanych językach oznacza tyle, co: ubogie mieszkanie, uboga karczma, szopa. Określenie to na przestrzeni lat przyjęło znaczenie odnoszące się do ubogiej karczmy portowej, przeznaczonej głównie dla rybaków i żeglarzy. Swoje pochodzenie wraz z nazwą wywodzi z krajów płd. Europy położonych nad Morzem Śródziemnym, zwłaszcza z Włoch.

TEXT.English: Pub
Build a Pub to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et le bonheur de la ville, mais aussi la criminalité.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un pub per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Pub by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A public house, informally known as a pub, is a drinking establishment fundamental to the culture of Britain, Ireland, Australia and New Zealand. There were approximately 53,500 public houses in 2009 in the United Kingdom. This number has been declining every year, so that nearly half of the smaller villages no longer have a local pub.
TEXT.Italian: Un pub è un locale che serve bevande alcoliche tipico della Gran Bretagna, dell'Irlanda, dell'Australia e della Nuova Zelanda. Nel 2009, nel Regno Unito esistevano più di 53000 pub; questo numero è in costante declino ogni anno, tanto che i villaggi più piccoli non possiedono più il loro pub locale.
TEXT.Polish: Pub (skrót od ang. public house, czyt. pub) - specyficzny rodzaj lokalu, będący skrzyżowaniem baru z klubem, gdzie podaje się głównie piwo. Puby spotyka się w Polsce, a przede wszystkim w Wielkiej Brytanii, Irlandii,Kanadzie, Australii, Nowej Zelandii oraz innych krajach pozostających pod wpływem kultury brytyjskiej. Pub jest nie tylko miejscem konsumpcji napojów alkoholowych, ale również miejscem spotkań towarzyskich, gier stolikowych, jak np. domino, szachy a także ruchowych, np. darts, kręgle. W wielu pubach można oglądać telewizyjne relacje ze spotkań sportowych. Niektóre z pubów oferują również usługi hotelowe.

TEXT.English: Dive Bar
TEXT.Italian: Bar
TEXT.Polish: Speluna

TEXT.English: Build a Dive Bar to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bar de jeu[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un bar per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Dive Bar by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A dive bar is a type of bar or pub. Dive bars generally have a relaxed and informal atmosphere, they are often referred to by local residents as neighborhood bars, where people in the neighborhood gather to drink and socialize. Individual bars may be considered to be disreputable, sinister, or even a detriment to the community.
TEXT.Italian: Un bar è un locale con un'atmosfera generalmente rilassata ed informale dove gli abitanti che vivono nelle vicinanze si riuniscono per bere e socializzare; a volte i bar hanno una reputazione ambigua, sinistra o addirittura negativa.
TEXT.Polish: Speluna to najgorszego rodzaju bar lub pub.

TEXT.English: Galactic Cantina
TEXT.French: Cantine Galactique
TEXT.Italian: Cantina galattica
TEXT.Polish: Galaktyczna Kantyna

TEXT.English: Build a Galactic Cantina to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cantine Galactique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una cantina galattica per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Galactic Cantina by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: The Galactic Cantina was a proposed cantina to be built on the surface of the Death Star. The cantina had a large green sign towering over the structure that read, in Aurebesh, Cantina. Stormtroopers and Moffs alike relaxed on their breaks. The bar was high-tech and capable of synthesizing almost any drink in the known galaxy, as well as over 16,000 well-known recipes. The building also featured a soundstage for live entertainment.
TEXT.French: The Cantine Galactique was a proposed cantina to be built on the surface of the Death Star. The cantina had a large green sign towering over the structure that read, in Aurebesh, Cantina. Stormtroopers and Moffs alike relaxed on their breaks. The bar was high-tech and capable of synthesizing almost any drink in the known galaxy, as well as over 16,000 well-known recipes. The building also featured a soundstage for live entertainment.
TEXT.Italian: La cantina galattica era un locale progettato per essere costruito sulla superficie Death Star. La cantina aveva una grande insegna verde che torreggiava sopra la struttura con la scritta, in caratteri Aurebesh, Cantina; i soldati erano soliti rilassarsi qui durante le loro pause. Il bar era ad alta tecnologia e in grado di sintetizzare praticamente qualsiasi bevanda nella galassia conosciuta, così come oltre 16.000 ricette ben note. L'edificio inoltre aveva un palco per l'intrattenimento dal vivo.

TEXT.English: Crime (Vigilantism)
TEXT.French: Délit (Justiciers)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Vigilantismo)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Samoobrona)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A vigilante is a private individual who presumes to carry out extralegal punishment in defiance of existing law.
TEXT.Italian: Un vigilante è un individuo che pretende di compiere punizioni extralegali andando contro alla legge esistente.
TEXT.Polish: Strażnik obywatelski jest osoba prywatna, która zakłada przeprowadzenie pozaprawnych karę wbrew obowiązującym prawem.

TEXT.English: Crime (Online Piracy)
TEXT.French: Crime (Piratage Info.)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Pirateria online)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Piractwo komputerowe)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: The copyright infringement of software refers to several practices which involve the unauthorized copying of computer software. Copyright infringement of this kind varies globally.
TEXT.Italian: La violazione del copyright del software si riferisce a diverse pratiche che coinvolgono la copia non autorizzata di software per computer. Violazioni del copyright di questo tipo sono diffuse, in vario modo, a livello globale.

TEXT.English: Crime (Hacking)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Hacker)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Hakerstwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Hacking means finding out weaknesses in a computer or computer network and exploiting them, though the term can also refer to someone with an advanced understanding of computers and computer networks.
TEXT.Italian: L'hackeraggio consiste nel trovare debolezze in un computer o in una rete di computer per poi sfruttarle; il termine hacker viene a volte ingiustamente usato per indicare una persona con una comprensione avanzata dei computer.

TEXT.English: Crime (Embezzlement)
TEXT.French: Crime (Détournement de fonds)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Appropriazione indebita)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Nadużycia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Embezzlement is the act of dishonestly appropriating or secreting assets by one or more individuals to whom such assets have been entrusted.
TEXT.Italian: L'appropriazione indebita è l'atto disonesto di appropriarsi di qualcosa da parte di uno o più individui ai quali questi oggetti erano stati affidati.

TEXT.English: Crime (Kidnapping)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Rapimenti)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Porwania)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: In criminal law, kidnapping is the taking away or transportation of a person against that person's will, usually to hold the person in false imprisonment, a confinement without legal authority. This may be done for ransom or in furtherance of another crime, or in connection with a child custody dispute.
TEXT.Italian: Il rapimento consiste nel portare via una persona contro la sua volontà, solitamente per tenere la persona imprigionata senza un'autorità legale. Può avvenire in concomitanza con un altro crimine, come ad esempio una disputa sull'affidamento dei bambini.

TEXT.English: Crime (Gene Forgery)
TEXT.French: Crime (Contrefaçon de Génétique)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Contraffazione genetica)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Fałszerstwo genów)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Gene Forgery is to falsify someones DNA through identity theft or to frame them of a crime.
TEXT.Italian: La falsificazione genetica consiste nella falsificazione del DNA di una persona tramite il furto di identità o per incolparla di un crimine.

TEXT.English: Crime (Littering)
TEXT.French: Délit (Dépot d'ordures)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Deposito di rifiuti)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Śmiecenie)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Litter consists of waste products that have been disposed of improperly, without consent, in an inappropriate location. Litter can also be used as a verb. To litter means to throw (often man-made) objects onto the ground and leave them as opposed to disposing of them properly.
TEXT.Italian: Il deposito di rifiuti consiste in prodotti di scarto che sono stati smaltiti in modo improprio, senza consenso, in un luogo inappropriato. Depositare significa buttare gli oggetti, spesso costruiti dall'uomo, a terra e lasciarli lì, al contrario di smaltirli in modo corretto.

TEXT.English: Crime (Money Laundering)
TEXT.French: Crime (Blanchiment d'argent)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Riciclaggio di denaro)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Pranie pieniędzy)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Money laundering is the process of concealing the source of legally, illegally, and grey area obtained money.
TEXT.Italian: Il riciclaggio di denaro consiste nel nascondere la fonte dei soldi ottenuti in maniera illegale o non del tutto legale.

TEXT.English: Crime (Trespassing)
TEXT.French: Crime (Usurpation)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Usurpazione)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Naruszanie prywatności)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Trespass is an area of tort law broadly divided into three groups: trespass to the person, trespass to chattels and trespass to land.
TEXT.Italian: L'usurpazione è un ramo del diritto civile diviso in tre parti: usurpazione ai danni della persona, usurpazione di beni immobili e usurpazione di terreni.

TEXT.English: Crime (Hate Crime)
TEXT.French: Crime (Racisme)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Odio razziale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przestępstwo nienawiści)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: In crime and law, hate crimes occur when a perpetrator targets a victim because of his or her perceived membership in a certain social group, usually defined by racial group, religion, sexual orientation, disability, class, ethnicity, nationality, age, sex, or gender identity.
TEXT.Italian: Secondo la legge, l'odio razziale si ha quando una persona sceglie una vittima a causa della sua appartenenza ad un determinato gruppo sociale, di solito definito dal gruppo razziale, religioso, si orientamento sessuale, di disabilità, di classe, di etnia, di nazionalità, di età, di sesso o di identità.

TEXT.English: Crime (Asimov Tampering)
TEXT.French: Crime (Falsification des lois de la Robotique)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Falsificazione delle leggi della robotica)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Zmiana praw robotyki)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Asimov Tampering is changing Asimov's 3 laws of robotics within the code of an android or robot.
TEXT.Italian: La falsificazione delle leggi della robotica consiste nel modificare la programmazione di un androide o un robot, in modo che esso possa disobbedire alle tre leggi postulate dallo scrittore Isaac Asimov.

TEXT.English: Crime (Illegal Brainwashing)
TEXT.French: Crime (Lavage de Cerveau Illégal)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Lavaggio del cervello illegale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Nielegalne pranie mózgu)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Brainwashing refers to a process in which a group or individual systematically uses unethically manipulative methods to persuade others to conform to the wishes of the manipulator(s), often to the detriment of the person being manipulated.
TEXT.Italian: Il lavaggio del cervello è un processo in cui una persona o un gruppo di persone usano sistematicamente dei metodi manipolativi per persuadere altre persone a conformarsi ai desideri e ai pensieri dei manipolatori, spesso a discapito della persona che viene manipolata.

TEXT.English: Crime (False Accusations)
TEXT.French: Crime (Fausses Accusations)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Accuse false)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Fałszywe oskarżenia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: False Accusations is to be blamed for something you did not do.
TEXT.Italian: Le accuse false sono accuse di aver fatto qualcosa che in realtà non si è fatto.

TEXT.English: Crime (Insubordination)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Insubordinazione)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Insurbordynacja)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Insubordination is the act of willfully disobeying an authority. Refusing to perform an action that is unethical or illegal is not insubordination; neither is refusing to perform an action that is not within the scope of authority of the person issuing the order.
TEXT.Italian: L'insubordinazione è l'atto di disobbedienza volontaria ad un'autorità. Rifiutarsi di compiere un'azione antietica o illegale non viene considerto come un'insubordinazione; non lo è nenache rifiutarsi di compiere un'azione che non rientra nell'autorità della persona che dà l'ordine.

TEXT.English: Crime (Child Labor)
TEXT.French: Crime (Travail des Enfants)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Lavoro minorile)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Praca dzieci)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Child labour refers to the employment of children in any work that deprives children of their childhood, interferes with their ability to attend regular school, and that is mentally, physically, socially or morally dangerous and harmful.
TEXT.Italian: Lavoro minorile si riferisce all'impiego di bambini in un qualsiasi lavoro che privi i bambini della loro infanzia, che interferisce con la loro possibilità di frequentare regolarmente la scuola e che è mentalmente, fisicamente, socialmente o moralmente pericoloso per loro.

TEXT.English: Crime (Sexual Harassment)
TEXT.French: Crime (Harcèlement Sexuel)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Molestie sessuali)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Seksualne molestowanie)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Sexual harassment is intimidation, bullying or coercion of a sexual nature, or the unwelcome or inappropriate promise of rewards in exchange for sexual favors. In most modern legal contexts sexual harassment is illegal. As defined by EEOC, "It is unlawful to harass a person (an applicant or employee) because of that person's sex." Harassment can include "sexual harassment" or unwelcome sexual advances, requests for sexual favors, and other verbal or physical harassment of a sexual nature.
TEXT.Italian: Le molestie sessuali sono intimidazioni, bullismo o coercizioni di natura sessuale, oppure la promessa non gradita o inadeguata di ricompense in cambio di favori sessuali. In contesti giuridici più moderni la molestia sessuale è illegale. Come definito dall'EEOC, "E 'illegale molestare una persona (un apprendista o dipendente), a causa del suo sesso." Le molestie possono includere "molestie sessuali" o sgradite avances sessuali, richieste di favori sessuali e altre molestie, verbali o fisiche, di natura sessuale.

TEXT.English: Crime (Military Desertion)
TEXT.French: Crime (Désertion Militaire)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Diserzione militare)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Dezercja)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: In military terminology, desertion is the abandonment of a "duty" or post without permission and is done with the intention of not returning. "Absence Without Leave" (AWOL) can refer to either desertion or a temporary absence.
TEXT.Italian: In termini militari, la diserzione è l'abbandono di un dovere o di una postazione, senza il permesso e con l'intenzione di non ritornare. AWOL (Absence WithOut Leave) può significare sia diserzione, sia assenza temporanea.

TEXT.English: Crime (Rioting)
TEXT.French: Crime (Participation aux émeutes)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Sommosse)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Zamieszki)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A riot is a form of civil disorder often characterized by what is thought of as disorganized groups lashing out in a sudden and intense rash of violence against authority, property or people. While individuals may attempt to lead or control a riot, riots are thought to be typically chaotic and exhibit herd behaviour, and usually generated by civil unrest. However, there is a growing body of evidence to suggest that riots are not irrational, herd-like behaviour, but follow inverted social norms.
TEXT.Italian: Una sommossa è una forma di disordine civile caratterizzata spesso da ciò che sembro un gruppo disorganizzato di persone che, in preda a un improvviso ed intenso raptus di violenza, si scaglia contro un'autorità, una proprietà e una persona. Anche se alcuni individui possono tentare di controllare una sommossa, essa è tipicamente caotica e mostra comportamenti tipici dei branchi animali, dato che è generata dall'agitazione popolare. In ogni caso, ci sono varie prove che suggeriscono che le sommosse non sono irrazionali, bensì seguono determinate norme sociali.

TEXT.English: Crime (Environmental Dumping)
TEXT.French: Crime (Déversement sauvage)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Abbandono di rifiuti)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Zanieczyszczanie środowiska)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Environmental dumping is the practice of transfrontier shipment of waste (household waste, industrial/nuclear waste, etc.) from one country to another. The goal is to take the waste to a country that has less strict environmental laws, or environmental laws that are not strictly enforced. The economic benefit of this practice is cheap disposal or recycling of waste without the economic regulations of the original country.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'attività consiste in spedizioni transfrontaliere di rifiuti (rifiuti domestici, industriali, nucleari ecc) da un paese all'altro. L'obiettivo è quello di portare i rifiuti in un paese che ha leggi ambientali meno severe o che non vengono rigidamente applicate. Il vantaggio economico di questa pratica è lo smaltimento a basso costo o il riciclaggio dei rifiuti, senza le regole economiche del paese originario.

TEXT.English: Crime (Car Bombing)
TEXT.French: Crime (Pose de Bombes)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Autobombe)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Samochody-pułapki)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A car bomb is an improvised explosive device placed inside a car or other vehicle and then detonated. It is commonly used as a weapon of assassination, terrorism or guerrilla warfare, to kill the occupants of the vehicle, people near the blast site, or to damage buildings or other property. Car bombs act as their own delivery mechanisms and can carry a relatively large amount of explosives without attracting suspicion; in larger vehicles and trucks, weights of at least 7000 pounds (3200 kg) have been used. Car bombs are activated in a variety of ways; including opening the vehicle's doors, starting the engine, depressing the accelerator or brake pedals or simply lighting a fuse or setting a timing device. The gasoline in the vehicle's fuel tanks makes the explosion of the bomb more powerful.
TEXT.Italian: Un'autobomba è costituita da un ordigno esplosivo che viene posizionato all'interno di un'auto o un altro veicolo, per poi essere fatto esplodere. Le autobombe vengono usate negli assassinii, dai terroristi o in atti di guerriglia; lo scopo è uccidere gli occupanti del veicolo, le persone vicine all'esplosione o per danneggiare edifici o altre proprietà. Le autobombe possono trasportare grandi quantità di esplosivo senza destare grandi sospetti; su alcuni camion sono state usate bombe pesanti più di 3200 kg. Le aautobombe vengono innescate in vari modi: aprendo le porte del veicolo, accendendo il motore, schiacciando l'acceleratore o il freno, o semplicemente con un radiocomando. La benzina presente nel serbatoio dell'auto rende l'esplosione della bomba ancora più potente.

TEXT.English: Crime (Sports Riots)
TEXT.French: Crime (Emeutes sportives)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Disordini sportivi)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Walki kiboli)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de Délit.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Sports riots are riots that occur during or after sporting events. Most riots are known to occur after the event is done, but some have been during the game.
TEXT.Italian: I disordini avvengono spesso durante o dopo gli eventi sportivi. La maggior parte di essi avvengono dopo la fine dell'evento, ma ci sono stati casi in cui sono avvenuti durante l'evento stesso.

TEXT.English: Crime (Aircraft Hijacking)
TEXT.French: Délit (Détournement d'avions)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Dirottamenti aerei)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Porwania samolotów)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de Délit.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Aircraft hijacking is the unlawful seizure of an aircraft by an individual or a group. In most cases, the pilot is forced to fly according to the orders of the hijackers. Occasionally, however, the hijackers have flown the aircraft themselves, such as the September 11 attacks of 2001. In at least one case, a plane was hijacked by the official pilot.
TEXT.Italian: I dirottamenti avvengono quando una ersona o un gruppo di persone prendono illegalmente il controllo di un aereo. Nella maggior parte dei casi il pilota viene costretto a volare secondo le indicazioni dei dirottatori; a volte, tuttavia, i dirottatori pilotano l'aereo di persona, come negli attacchi dell'11 settembre 2001. In rari casi, l'aereo può essere dirottato dallo stesso pilota.

TEXT.English: Crime (Gun Rampage)
TEXT.French: Délit (Possession d'armes)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Sparatorie)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Strzelaniny)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de Délit.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: An active shooter is defined as "... an armed person who has used deadly physical force on other persons and continues to do so while having unrestricted access to additional victims."
TEXT.Italian: Un tiratore attivo è definito come "... una persona armata che ha usato una forza fisica di intensità mortale conro altre persone, e continua a farlo finchè ha accesso a nuove vittime."

TEXT.English: Crime (Timeline Tampering)
TEXT.French: Délit (Altération du temps)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Manomissione temporale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Manipulowanie strumieniem czasu)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de Délit.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Timeline Tampering is when one goes back in time to change the past to influence the future.
TEXT.Italian: La manomissione temporale avviene quando una persona viaggia nel passato per influenzare il futuro.

TEXT.English: Crime (Cyberbullying)
TEXT.French: Délit (Agression verbale numérique)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Cyberbullying)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Hejterstwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Cyberbullying is the use of the Internet and related technologies to harm or harass other people in a deliberate, repeated, and hostile manner. As it has become more common in society, particularly among young people, legislation and awareness campaigns have arisen to combat it.
Crime (School Shootings)
TEXT.French: Délit (Massacre étudiant)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (School Shootings)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Strzelaniny w szkołach)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A school shooting is an occurrence in which gun violence takes place at an educational institution. A school shooting involves a firearm being discharged at a school infrastructure, and may refer to incidents of shootings on a school bus or near school property while school is in session.
Crime (Truancy)
TEXT.French: Délit (Truandage)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Truancy)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Wagary)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Truancy is any intentional unauthorized or illegal absence from compulsory education. The term describes absences caused by students of their own free will, and usually does not refer to legitimate "excused" absences, such as ones related to medical conditions. The term's exact meaning differs from school to school, and is usually explicitly defined in the school's handbook of policies and procedures.
Crime (Shoplifting)
TEXT.French: Délit (Vol à l'étalage)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Shoplifting)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kradzież sklepowa)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Shoplifting is theft of goods from a retail establishment. It is one of the most common crimes.
Crime (Domestic Violence)
TEXT.French: Délit (Violence domestique)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Domestic Violence)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przemoc domowa)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Domestic violence, is a pattern of behavior which involves the abuse by one partner against another in an intimate relationship such as marriage, cohabitation, dating or within the family. Domestic violence can take many forms, including physical aggression or assault (hitting, kicking, biting, shoving, restraining, slapping, throwing objects, battery), or threats thereof; sexual abuse; emotional abuse; controlling or domineering; intimidation; stalking; passive/covert abuse (e.g., neglect); and economic deprivation.
Crime (Medical Fraud)
TEXT.French: Délit (Fraude médicale)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Medical Fraud)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Oszustwo medyczne)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Quackery is the promotion of unproven or fraudulent medical practices. Random House Dictionary describes a quack as a fraudulent or ignorant pretender to medical skill or a person who pretends, professionally or publicly, to have skill, knowledge, or qualifications he or she does not possess; a charlatan.
Crime (Internet Fraud)
TEXT.French: Délit (Fraude sur Internet)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Internet Fraud)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Oszustwo internetowe)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: The use of Internet services or software with Internet access to defraud victims or to otherwise take advantage of them, for example by stealing personal information, which can even lead to identity theft. A very common form of Internet fraud is the distribution of rogue security software. Internet services can be used to present fraudulent solicitations to prospective victims, to conduct fraudulent transactions, or to transmit the proceeds of fraud to financial institutions or to others connected with the scheme.
Crime (Malware)
TEXT.French: Délit (Malware)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Malware)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Malware)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Malware is software used or programmed by attackers to disrupt computer operation, gather sensitive information, or gain access to private computer systems. It can appear in the form of code, scripts, active content, and other software. Malware is a general term used to refer to a variety of forms of hostile or intrusive software.
Crime (Animal Abuse)
TEXT.French: Délit (Abus d'Animaux)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Animal Abuse)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Molestowanie zwierząt)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Animal Abuse is the human infliction of suffering or harm upon non-human animals, for purposes other than self-defense or survival. More narrowly, it can be harm for specific gain, such as killing animals for food or for their fur, although opinions differ with respect to the method of slaughter. It usually encompasses inflicting harm for personal amusement (see zoosadism). Diverging viewpoints are held by jurisdictions throughout the world. Laws concerning animal cruelty are designed to prevent needless cruelty to animals, rather than killing for other aims, such as food, or they concern species not eaten as food in the country involved, such as those regarded as pets.
Crime (Elder Abuse)
TEXT.French: Délit (Abus de personnes âgées)
TEXT.Italian: Crimine (Elder Abuse)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przemoc wobec starszych)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.French: Un type de crime.
TEXT.Italian: Un tipo di crimine.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Elder abuse is a single, or repeated act, or lack of appropriate action, occurring within any relationship where there is an expectation of trust, which causes harm or distress to an older person. This definition has been adopted by the World Health Organization from a definition put forward by Action on Elder Abuse in the UK. Laws protecting the elderly from abuse are similar to, and related to, laws protecting dependent adults from abuse.
Crime (Sectarian Violence)
TEXT.French: Délit (Violence sectaire)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przemoc w sektach)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Sectarian violence and/or sectarian strife is violence inspired by sectarianism, that is, between different sects of one particular mode of ideology or religion within a nation/community. Religious segregation often plays a role in sectarian violence.
Crime (Drug Cartels)
TEXT.French: Délit (Cartel de la drogue)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kartele narkotykowe)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A drug cartel is a criminal organization developed with the primary purpose of promoting and controlling drug trafficking operations. They range from loosely managed agreements among various drug traffickers to formalized commercial enterprises.
Crime (Gang Warfare)
TEXT.French: Délit (Guerre de Gang)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Wojny gangów)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A gang is a group of recurrently associating individuals or close friends or family with identifiable leadership and internal organization, identifying with or claiming control over territory in a community, and engaging either individually or collectively in violent or other forms of illegal behavior.
Crime (Human Trafficking)
TEXT.French: Délit (Trafic Humain)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przemyt ludzi)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Human trafficking is the trade in humans, most commonly for the purpose of sexual slavery, forced labor or commercial sexual exploitation for the trafficker or others; or for the extraction of organs or tissues, including surrogacy and ova removal; or for providing a spouse in the context of forced marriage.
TEXT.Polish: Human trafficking is the trade in humans, most commonly for the purpose of sexual slavery, forced labor or commercial sexual exploitation for the trafficker or others; or for the extraction of organs or tissues, including surrogacy and ova removal; or for providing a spouse in the context of forced marriage.

TEXT.English: Crime (Looting)
TEXT.French: Délit (Pillage)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Szabrowania)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Looting, also referred to as sacking, plundering, despoiling, despoliation, and pillaging, is the indiscriminate taking of goods by force as part of a military or political victory, or during a catastrophe, such as war, natural disaster, or rioting.
Crime (Lying)
A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A lie is an assertion that is believed to be false, typically used with the purpose of deceiving someone. The practice of communicating lies is called lying, and a person who communicates a lie may be termed a liar. Lies may serve a variety of instrumental, interpersonal, or psychological functions for the individuals who use them.
Crime (Prison Breakouts)
TEXT.French: Délit (Evasion de Prison)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Ucieczka z więzienia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A prison escape or prison break is the act of an inmate leaving prison through unofficial or illegal ways. Normally, when this occurs, an effort is made on the part of authorities to recapture them and return them to their original detainers.
Crime (Unlicensed Cloning)
TEXT.French: Délit (Clonage illégal)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Nielicencjowane klonowanie)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: In biology, cloning is the process of producing similar populations of genetically identical individuals that occurs in nature when organisms such as bacteria, insects or plants reproduce asexually.
Crime (Cyberwarfare)
TEXT.French: Délit (Guerre cybernétique)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Cyberwojny)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Cyberwarfare is politically motivated hacking to conduct sabotage and espionage. It is a form of information warfare sometimes seen as analogous to conventional warfare.
Crime (Corruption)
TEXT.French: Délit (Corruption)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Korupcja)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: The word corrupt when used as an adjective literally means "utterly broken". The word was first used by Aristotle and later by Cicero who added the terms bribe and abandonment of good habits.
Crime (Weapons Trafficking)
TEXT.French: Délit (Trafic d'armes)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Handel Bronią)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Arms trafficking, also known as gunrunning, is the illegal trafficking or smuggling of contraband weapons or ammunition. What constitutes legal trade in firearms varies widely, depending on local and national laws.
TEXT.Polish: Handel bronią, znany również jako dyscyplina, jest nielegalny handel bronią i przemyt kontrabandy lub amunicji. Co stanowi legalnego handlu bronią palną jest bardzo zróżnicowana, w zależności od przepisów lokalnych i krajowych.

TEXT.English: Crime (Armed Communities)
TEXT.French: Délit (Communautés armées)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Społeczności zbrojnych)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: The right to keep and bear arms is the people's right to have their own arms for their defense as described in the philosophical and political writings of Aristotle.
TEXT.Polish: Prawo do posiadania i noszenia broni jest prawem ludzi do mają swoje ramiona dla ich obrony, jak opisano w filozoficznych i politycznych pism Arystotelesa.

TEXT.English: Crime (Organ Trafficking)
TEXT.French: Délit (Trafic d'organes)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Handel organami)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Organ trade is the trade involving inner human organs (heart, liver, kidneys, etc.) for organ transplantation.
Crime (Stock Market Rigging)
TEXT.French: Délit (Entente illégale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Ustawianie giełdy)

TEXT.English: Crime (Bribery)
TEXT.French: Délit (Pot de vin)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Przekupstwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Bribery is an act of giving money or gift giving that alters the behavior of the recipient, where the gift is of a dishonest nature.
Crime (Black Markets)
TEXT.French: Délit (Marché noir)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Czarny rynek)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A black market or underground economy is the market in which goods or services are traded illegally. The key distinction of a black market trade is that the transaction itself is illegal.
Crime (Ponzi Schemes)
TEXT.French: Délit (Emprunts toxiques)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Schemat Ponziego)

TEXT.English: Crime (Identity Theft)
TEXT.French: Délit (Vol d'Identité)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Kradzież tożsamości)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Identity theft is a form of stealing someone's identity in which someone pretends to be someone else by assuming that person's identity, usually as a method to gain access to resources or obtain credit and other benefits in that person's name.
Crime (Racketeering)
TEXT.French: Délit (Racket)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Rekieterstwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: A racket is a service that is fraudulently offered to solve a problem, such as for a problem that does not actually exist, that will not be put into effect, or that would not otherwise exist if the racket were not to exist. Conducting a racket is racketeering.
Crime (Insider Trading)
TEXT.French: Délit (Délit d'initié)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Oszustwa akcyjne)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Insider trading is the trading of a public company's stock or other securities (such as bonds or stock options) by individuals with access to non-public information about the company. In various countries, insider trading based on inside information is illegal. This is because it is seen as unfair to other investors who do not have access to the information.
Crime (Tax Evasion)
TEXT.French: Délit (Evasion fiscale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Unikanie opodatkowania)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Tax evasion is the illegal evasion of taxes by individuals, corporations and trusts. Tax evasion often entails taxpayers deliberately misrepresenting the true state of their affairs to the tax authorities to reduce their tax liability and includes dishonest tax reporting, such as declaring less income, profits or gains than the amounts actually earned, or overstating deductions.
Crime (Illegal Immigration)
TEXT.French: Délit (Immigration Illégale)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Nielegalna imigracja)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Illegal immigration refers to the migration of people across national borders, or the residence of foreign nationals in a country, in a way that is illegal according to the immigration laws of the destination country. Citing economic reasons and military security many countries designate some forms of immigration as illegal.
Crime (Extortion)
TEXT.French: Délit (Extortion)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Wyłudzenie świadczenia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Extortion is a criminal offense of obtaining money, property, or services from a person, entity, or institution, through coercion.
TEXT.Polish: Oszustwa opiekuńcze jest umyślne nadużycie systemów opieki socjalnej państwa poprzez zatajanie informacji lub składanie fałszywych lub błędnych informacji.

TEXT.English: Crime (Insurance Fraud)
TEXT.French: Délit (Fraude à l'assurance)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Oszustwo ubezpieczeniowe)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Insurance fraud occurs when any act is committed with the intent to fraudulently obtain some benefit or advantage to which they are not otherwise entitled or someone knowingly denies some benefit that is due and to which someone is entitled.
Crime (Blackmail)
TEXT.French: Délit (Chantage)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Szantaż)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Blackmail is an act, often a crime, involving unjustified threats to make a gain or cause loss to another unless a demand is met.
Crime (Welfare Fraud)
TEXT.French: Délit (Fraude sanitaire)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Wyłudzenia)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Welfare fraud is intentional misuse of state welfare systems by withholding information or giving false or inaccurate information.
TEXT.Polish: Extortion is a criminal offense of obtaining money, property, or services from a person, entity, or institution, through coercion.

TEXT.English: Crime (Public Intoxication)
TEXT.French: Délit (Intoxication Publique)
TEXT.Polish: Przestępstwa (Publiczne pijaństwo)

TEXT.English: A type of crime.
TEXT.Polish: Rodzaj przestępstwa.

TEXT.English: Public intoxication is a summary offense in some countries rated to public cases or displays of drunkenness. Public intoxication laws vary widely from country to country, but usually require some obvious display of intoxicated incompetence or behavior disruptive/obnoxious to public order before the charge is levied.
Farm - Animal (Silk)
TEXT.Italian: Coltivazione di bachi da seta
TEXT.Polish: Farma Jedwabników

TEXT.English: Build a Silk Farm to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ferme de vers à soie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una coltivazione di bachi da seta per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Silk Farm by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Silk is a natural protein fibre, some forms of which can be woven into textiles.
TEXT.Italian: La seta è una fibra proteica naturale; alcuni tipi di questa proteina possone essere tessuti formando dei fili.
TEXT.Polish: Jedwab - włókno pochodzenia zwierzęcego (białkowe) uzyskiwane z kokonu jedwabnika morwowego lub jedwabnika dębowego. Światowa produkcja jedwabiu na poziomie ok. 50 000 ton rocznie stanowi 0,2% całej produkcji włókien. Jedwab to również nazwa tkanin produkowanych z przędzy uzyskiwanej z tego włókna. Tkaniny jedwabne charakteryzują się połyskiem, są gładkie, śliskie, wiotkie, miękkie, lekkie, cienkie i bardzo przyjemne w dotyku. Niegdyś stosowane jako podłoże malarskie, zwłaszcza w sztuce orientalnej. Z włókien jedwabnych produkowano sita służące w technice druku zwanej sitodrukiem.

TEXT.English: Plantation (Cannabis)
TEXT.Italian: Piantagione di cannabis
TEXT.Polish: Plantacja Marihuany

TEXT.English: Build a Cannabis Plantation to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plantation de Cannabis[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una piantagione di cannabis per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cannabis Plantation by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Hemp is the name of the soft, durable fibre that is cultivated from plants of the Cannabis genus, cultivated for industrial and commercial use.
TEXT.Italian: Canapa è il nome della fibra soffice e resistente che deriva dalle piante del genere Cannabis, coltivate per usi industriali e commerciali.
TEXT.Polish: Marihuana - suszone i czasem sfermentowane kwiatostany (niejednokrotnie z niewielką domieszką liści) żeńskich roślin konopi (Cannabis sativa) zawierające substancje psychoaktywne z grupy kannabinoli, działające agonistycznie na receptory kanabinoidowe, podobnie jak anandamid - ludzki endogenny kannabinoid. Za działanie psychotropowe marihuany odpowiada głównie tetrahydrokannabinol (THC) oraz inne kannabinoidy.

TEXT.English: Plantation (Cotton)
TEXT.Italian: Piantagione di cotone
TEXT.Polish: Plantacja Bawełny

TEXT.English: Build a Cotton Plantation to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plantation de Coton[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una piantagione di cotone per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cotton Plantation by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Cotton is a soft, fluffy, staple fiber that grows in a boll around the seeds of the cotton plant.
TEXT.Italian: Il cotone è una fibra morbida, che cresce in fiocchi attorno a una capsula intorno ai semi della pianta del cotone.
TEXT.Polish: Bawełna - włókno otaczające nasiona rośliny określanej tą samą nazwą - bawełny (Gossypium), mające wiele zastosowań. Służy m.in. do wytwarzania miękkiej tkaniny - najpopularniejszej w przemyśle tekstylnym, a także, ze względu na silne własności absorpcyjne, do produkcji materiałów opatrunkowych. Włókno bawełniane jest też stosowane w mieszankach włókien, jako dodatek do wełny czy lnu.

TEXT.English: Grove (Papyrus)
TEXT.Italian: Bosco di papiri
TEXT.Polish: Gaj Papirusu

TEXT.English: Build a Papyrus Grove to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parcelle de Papyrus[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un bosco di papiri per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Papyrus Grove by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Papyrus is a thick paper-like material produced from the pith of the papyrus plant, Cyperus papyrus, a wetland sedge that was once abundant in the Nile Delta of Egypt.
TEXT.Italian: Il papiro è un materiale simile alla carta spesso prodotta dal midollo della pianta omonima, il Cyperus papyrus, una pianta acquatica che un tempo era abbondante nel delta del Nilo d'Egitto.
TEXT.Polish: Papirus - materiał pisarski otrzymywany z tzw. trzciny papirusowej (pl. Cibora papirusowa, łac. Cyperus papyrus) rosnącej na bagnistych terenach strefy podzwrotnikowej. Długość jej łodyg dochodzi do 3 metrów. Roślina ta niegdyś powszechnie występowała wdelcie Nilu, obecnie rzadko spotykana.

TEXT.English: Plantation (Agave)
TEXT.Italian: Piantagione di agave
TEXT.Polish: Plantacja Agawy

TEXT.English: Build an Agave Plantation to increase your cities wealth and happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plantation d'Agaves[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse et le bonheur de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una piantagione di agave per incrementare la ricchezza e la felicità della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Agave Plantation to increase your cities wealth and happiness.

TEXT.English: Blue Agave is base ingredient of tequila.
TEXT.Italian: L'agave blu è l'ingrediente base della tequila.
