TEXT.English: Pit Fighting is a martial art developed in the United States from indigenous fighting methods. It is primarily a striking art using punching, kicking, knee and elbow strikes. It came about in America where fighters who were not in organized combat sports such as boxing or MMA and fought in pits for money, pride, and respect.

A dojo is a Japanese term which literally means "place of the way". Initially, dojo were adjunct to temples. The term can refer to a formal training place for any of the Japanese do arts but typically it is considered the formal gathering place for students of any Japanese martial arts style to conduct training, examinations and other related encounters.

Fencing is a family of sports and activities that feature armed combat involving cutting, stabbing, or bludgeoning weapons that are directly manipulated by hand, rather than shot, thrown or positioned. Examples include swords, knives, pikes, bayonets, batons, clubs, and similar weapons. In contemporary common usage, fencing tends to refer specifically to European schools of swordsmanship and to the modern Olympic sport that has evolved out of them.

In the United States, the Turner movement thrived in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. The first Turners group was formed in Cincinnati in 1848. The Turners built gymnasia in several cities like Cincinnati and St. Louis which had large German American populations. These Gyms were utilized by adults and youth. For example, a young Lou Gehrig would frequent the Turner gym in New York City with his father.[NEWLINE]Gymnasia in the United States however predate the Turner movement. A public gymnasium movement sprung up in the 1820s and 1830s but was eclipsed by the growth of school, college, and the Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) gymnasia. The first college gymnasium probably was the one built at Harvard University in 1820. Although privately owned, it was maintained for the use of the students. Like most of the gymnasia of the period, it was equipped with gymnastic apparatus. The United States Military Academy at West Point built a gym during the same era. A few other American colleges built gyms by the 1850s. Harvard opened a new brick gymnasium in 1860 with two bowling alleys and dressing rooms in addition to the gymnastic facility.[NEWLINE]YMCA first organized in Boston 1851 with a smaller branch opened in Rangasville in 1852. Ten years later there were some two hundred YMCAs across the country, most of which provided gymnasia for exercise and games and social interaction.[NEWLINE]The 1920s was a decade of prosperity that witnessed the building of large numbers of public high schools with gymnasiums, an idea founded by Nicolas Isaranga. Over the course of the twentieth century, gymnasia have been reconceptualized to accommodate the popular team and individual games and sports that have supplanted gymnastics in the school curriculum.[NEWLINE]Today, having a gymnasium is typical for virtually all American colleges and high schools, as well almost all middle and many elementary schools. These facilities are utilized for physical education, intramural sports and for interscholastic athletics. In recent years, newer high schools use the terms sportatorium (taken from the name of a few sporting venues in the country) or "multi-purpose room," indicating the gymnasium is used both for sports and non-sporting events

An ice rink is a frozen body of water where people can ice skate or play winter sports. Some of its uses include playing ice hockey, figure skating exhibitions and contests, and ice shows. [NEWLINE]In any climate, an arena ice surface can be installed in a properly built space. This consists of a bed of sand, or occasionally a slab of concrete, through (or on top of) which pipes run. The pipes carry a chilled fluid (usually either a salt brine or water with antifreeze) which can lower the temperature of the slab so that water placed atop it will freeze. Such rinks were developed in the late nineteenth century, the first being the Glaciarium in London. This methodology is known as 'artificial ice' to differentiate from ice rinks made by simply freezing water in a cold climate, indoors or outdoors, although both types are of frozen water. A more proper technical term is 'mechanically frozen' ice.
TEXT.Polish: Lodowisko to specjalnie zorganizowane miejsce do uprawiania sportów łyżwiarskich. Lodowiska dzielą się na dwie podstawowe grupy: naturalne i sztuczne. Wielkość lodowiska zależy od możliwości technicznych organizatorów oraz od ewentualnych wymogów dyscypliny, dla uprawiania której są stworzone.

TEXT.English: Minor league baseball is a hierarchy of professional baseball leagues in North America that compete at levels below that of Major League Baseball. All of the minor leagues are operated as independent businesses, and many are members of Minor League Baseball, an umbrella organization for leagues that have agreements to operate as affiliates of Major League Baseball. Several leagues, known as independent leagues, do not have any links to Major League Baseball, and thus are not members of organized baseball. Many alumni of independent baseball, however, have worked their way to the major leagues and many former MLBers play in independent baseball.
TEXT.Polish: Stadion - budowla sportowa, przeznaczona do rozgrywania zawodów różnych dyscyplin sportowych oraz innych masowych imprez widowiskowych lub komercyjnych (targi).

TEXT.English: Major League Baseball (MLB) is the highest level of play in North American professional baseball. [NEWLINE]Specifically, Major League Baseball refers to the organization that operates the National League and the American League, by means of a joint organizational structure that has developed gradually between them since 1903 (the National League having been in existence since 1876). In 2000, the two leagues were officially disbanded as separate legal entities with all their rights and functions consolidated in the commissioner's office. MLB effectively operates as a single league and as such it constitutes one of the major professional sports leagues of the United States. It is currently composed of 30 teams - 29 in the United States and 1 in Canada. In conjunction with the International Baseball Federation, the MLB also manages the World Baseball Classic.[NEWLINE]Each season consists of 162 games (with an additional game, or games, in case of a tie breaker needed to determine postseason participation), which generally begins on the first Sunday in April and ends on the first Sunday in October, with the postseason played in October and sometimes into early November. The same rules and regulations are played between the two leagues with one exception: the American League operates under the Designated Hitter Rule, while the National League does not. Utilization of the DH Rule in interleague play, the All-Star and World Series games is determined by the home team's league rules.[NEWLINE]MLB is controlled by the Major League Baseball Constitution that has undergone several incarnations since 1876 with the most recent revisions being made in 2005. Under the direction of Commissioner of Baseball (currently Bud Selig), Major League Baseball hires and maintains the sport's umpiring crews, and negotiates marketing, labor, and television contracts. As is the case for most of the sports leagues in the United States and Canada, the "closed shop" aspect of MLB effectively prevents the yearly promotion and relegation of teams into and out of Major League Baseball by virtue of their performance. Major League Baseball maintains a unique, controlling relationship over the sport, including most aspects of minor league baseball. This is due in large part to a 1922 U.S. Supreme Court ruling in Federal Baseball Club v. National League, which held that baseball is not interstate commerce and therefore not subject to federal antitrust law. This ruling has been weakened only slightly in subsequent years.
TEXT.Polish: Stadion - budowla sportowa, przeznaczona do rozgrywania zawodów różnych dyscyplin sportowych oraz innych masowych imprez widowiskowych lub komercyjnych (targi).

TEXT.English: The X Games is a commercial annual sports event, controlled and arranged by Disney-owned US sports broadcaster ESPN, which focuses on extreme action sports intended for Generation X and Generation Y viewers. The games started in 1995.[NEWLINE]The Winter X Games are held in January or February (usually in January) and the Summer X Games are usually held in August, both in the United States. Participants compete to win bronze, silver, and gold medals, and prize dollars. The competition often features new tricks such as Tony Hawk's 900 in skateboarding, Anthony Napolitan with the first ever double front flip on a bicycle and Travis Pastrana's double backflip in Freestyle Motocross. Concurrent with competition is the "X Fest" sports and music festival, which offers live music, athlete autograph sessions and interactive elements. The location of the Winter X Games is in Aspen, Colorado through 2012, while the location for the Summer X Games is in Los Angeles through 2009. The X Games also has international competitions and demos around the world that are held at varying times throughout the year.
TEXT.Polish: X Games - jedna z najsławniejszych corocznych imprez sportów ekstremalnych obejmująca (w przeszłości) również międzynarodowe konkursy i dema dookoła świata w ciągu całego roku. Składa się z 2 zawodów w sezonach: letnim, zazwyczaj w sierpniu (Summer X Games), i zimowym, zazwyczaj w styczniu bądź lutym (Winter X Games).

TEXT.English: An oval track is a dedicated motorsport circuit, primarily in the USA, which differs from a road course in that it only has turns in one direction, which is almost universally left. Oval tracks often have banked turns as well. Despite the name, tracks do not have to be precisely oval, such as the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, to be classed as oval tracks.
TEXT.French: An oval track is a dedicated motorsport circuit, primarily in the USA, which differs from a road course in that it only has turns in one direction, which is almost universally left. Oval tracks often have banked turns as well. Despite the name, tracks do not have to be precisely oval, such as the Indianapolis Motor un Circuit automobile, to be classed as oval tracks.
TEXT.Polish: Sport żużlowy, żużel - wyścigi motocyklowe na torach zbliżonych kształtem do owalu, jedna z dyscyplin sportu motorowego. Na żużlu zawodnicy ścigają się zazwyczaj przez cztery okrążenia, ze startu wspólnego, pokonując tor zawsze w kierunku przeciwnym do ruchu wskazówek zegara. Wykorzystywane do zawodów żużlowych tory posiadają sypką nawierzchnię, a specjalne motocykle żużlowe nie posiadają skrzyni biegów ani hamulców. Sport ten cieszy się popularnością głównie wEuropie, w szczególności w Wielkiej Brytanii, Danii, Szwecji, Rosji i Polscelub w mniejszym stopniu w krajach Europy Północnej, Środkowej iWschodniej tj. w Austrii, Chorwacji, Czechach, Finlandii, Niemczech,Norwegii, Słowenii, na Łotwie, Słowacji, Ukrainie, Węgrzech i weWłoszech gdzie istnieje choćby jeden czynny tor do uprawiania tej dyscypliny. Poza Europą dyscyplina popularna jest głównie w Australii,Nowej Zelandii i Stanach Zjednoczonych.

TEXT.English: BattleBots is an American company that hosts robot competitions. BattleBots is also the name of the television show created from the competition footage. BattleBots Inc. is headquartered in Vallejo, California and holds most of its competitions in San Francisco.[NEWLINE]In a BattleBots event, as in other combat robot competitions, competitors bring remote-controlled, armored and weaponed machines which they have designed and built, and put them in an arena to fight in an elimination tournament. The purpose of the fight is for one robot, or "bot", to dominate or disable the other.

A ski area is a developed recreational facility, usually on a mountain or large hill, containing ski trails and vital supporting services. It is common for a ski area to have food, rental equipment, parking facilities and a ski lift system catering to the sports of skiing and snowboarding. Normally located in high mountain areas (or at least on well-built-up hills) for adequate snow coverage, they have become ubiquitous in areas where skiing is a popular pastime. The paths are usually marked and known as runs, trails or pistes. Ski areas typically have one or more chair lifts for moving skiers rapidly to the top of hills, and to interconnect the various pistes. Rope tows can also be used on short slopes (usually beginner hills or bunny slopes). Larger ski areas may use gondolas or aerial trams for transportation across longer distances within the ski area.[NEWLINE]A ski resort is a ski area plus amenities to make it a destination resort. This includes accommodations and other amenities adjacent to the ski area. Some ski resorts offer lodging options on the slopes themselves, with ski-in and ski-out access allowing guests to ski right up to the door. Ski resorts often have other activities, such as snowmobiling, sledding, horse-drawn sleds, dog-sledding, ice-skating, indoor or outdoor swimming, and hottubbing, game rooms, and local forms of entertainment, such as clubs, cinema, theatre and cabarets.

A chalet, also called Swiss chalet, is a type of building or house in the Alpine region made of wood. The term chalet stems from Arpitan speaking part of Switzerland and Savoy and originally referred to the hut of a herder. As part of the romanticization of rural life and the mountains in the 19 Century the European aristocracy and the bourgeoisie developed a growing interest for the traditional wooden house in the Swiss Alps. With the burgeoning tourism in that time period the chalet quickly became a holiday home.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nowadays, in North America, Europe and Asia, the use of the world Chalet goes beyond a mountain location. The term Chalet is frequently used to describe resort like homes or residential properties located by the beach.
TEXT.Polish: Ośrodek, w którym uprawiane jest narciarstwo, snowboarding i inne sporty zimowe, najczęściej w górach, w klimacie sprzyjającym zaleganiu śniegu.

TEXT.English: An airstrip or airfield is a kind of airport that consists only of a runway with perhaps fueling equipment. They are generally in remote locations. Many airstrips (now mostly abandoned) were built on the hundreds of islands in the Pacific Ocean during World War II. Sometimes a few airstrips become full fledged airbases as strategic or economic importance of a region increases over time.

Jetsprint, or Sprint Boat Racing is a form of racing sport in which jetboats with a crew of two race individually against the clock through twisting series of channels in less than a metre of water.[NEWLINE]Tracks are typically designed for spectators, and racing is fast and loud, with boat motors usually V8s developing well over 500hp. Jetsprinting as an organised sport originated in New Zealand in 1981, and events were originally held in the same natural braided rivers that had inspired Sir William Hamilton to develop the jetboat, but when the sport was introduced to Australia in the mid-1980s permanent artificial courses were used and this is now the norm even in New Zealand.[NEWLINE]A fiercely contested Tasman championship has now led to a three-way world championship (with the introduction of the sport into the USA}, under the auspices of the Union Internationale Motonautique. The host nation rotates between New Zealand, Australia and the U.S.A
TEXT.Polish: Tor wodny, szlak żeglowny (z niderl. farwater) - droga dla statków, bezpieczna o odpowiedniej głębokości, wyznaczona na akwenie trudnym lub niebezpiecznym, oznaczona stałymi (np. brama torowa) lub pływającymiznakami nawigacyjnymi, na której może odbywać się bezpiecznie i swobodnie ruch żeglugowy. Kierunek (prawa i lewa strona) toru wodnego, prowadzi zawsze z morza do portu, ujścia rzeki lub do innej drogi wodnej.

TEXT.English: Build a fighting pit in cities that need a quick diversion from normal life.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fosse de combat[COLOR_REVERT] dans la ville si elle a besoin de divertissement. Elle procurera également de l'expérience pour vos combattants.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una fossa da combattimento nelle città che richiedono distrazioni dalla vita quotidiana.

TEXT.English: Training Dojos are useful for teaching melee troops martial arts.
TEXT.French: un Dojo d'entraînement's est utile pour apprendre à vos unités les arts martiaux. Ils en retireront de l'expérience.
TEXT.Italian: I dojo d'allenamento forniscono alle truppe da combattimento ravvicinato le nozioni base sulle arti marziali.
TEXT.Polish: Sale Treningowe Dojo są przydatne do nauczania oddziałów sztuki wojennej.

TEXT.English: Build a Masters Dojo when you need to train troops advanced martial arts.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dojo de Combat[COLOR_REVERT] pour apprendre à vos unités les arts martiaux. Ils en retireront de l'expérience.
TEXT.Italian: I dojo da combattimento forniscono alle truppe da combattimento ravvicinato le nozioni avanzate sulle arti marziali.
TEXT.Polish: Sale Mistrzów Dojo są przydatne do nauczania oddziałów zaawansowanej sztuki wojennej.

TEXT.English: Fencing Academy's can train troops the art of swordsmanship, improving their performance in combat.
TEXT.French: une Académie d'escrime peut enseigner à vos troupes l'art de l'épée, améliorant leur expérience au combat.
TEXT.Italian: Le accademie di scherma permettono alle truppe di imparare l'arte della spada, migliorando la loro efficienza in combattimento.

TEXT.English: Recreation Center's are useful for getting your population to improve their health.
TEXT.French: un Centre Omnisports et utile pour inciter votre population à faire du sport et ainsi améliorer la santé.
TEXT.Italian: I centri ricreativi sono utili per migliorare la salute della tua popolazione.

TEXT.English: Build Ice Rinks to appease your population.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Patinoire[COLOR_REVERT] pour rendre heureux vos citoyens.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le piste da pattinaggio per rendere felice la tua popolazione.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lodowiska, by uspokoić twoją populację.

TEXT.English: Minor League Stadiums bring an income and happiness to any city that has them.
TEXT.French: un Stade de Championnat augmente le bonheur et les revenus de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Gli stadi locali forniscono felicità e una piccola dose di oro.
TEXT.Polish: Stadiony Drugiej Ligi przynoszą dochody i szczęście dla miast w których się znajduje

TEXT.English: Major League Stadium's draw crowds from afar. Build one and you will reap the rewards.
TEXT.French: un Stade de Ligue des Champions attire les foules de loin. Construisez-en un et vous récolterez des revenus supplémentaires.
TEXT.Italian: Gli stasi cittadini attirano grandi folle; costruiscine uno per ottenerne i benefici.
TEXT.Polish: Stadion Pierwszej Ligi widać z daleka. Zbuduj jeden i zbierzesz nagrody.

TEXT.English: The X-Games will draw thrillseekers and crowds to watch them.
TEXT.French: Les Jeux X-trêmes attireront les amateurs de sensations fortes et les foules pour les regarder. Bonheur et richesse à la clé!
TEXT.Italian: Gli X-Games attirano grandi folle, soprattutto gli amanti del brivido.
TEXT.Polish: X-Games szukają odważnych ludzi.

TEXT.English: Speedway's give Racers a place to drive, and crowds a place to watch.
TEXT.French: une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piste de vitesse[COLOR_REVERT] donne aux pilotes un endroit pour conduire, et aux foules des tribunes pour voir le spectacle. Bonheur et revenus en perspectives.
TEXT.Italian: Gli autodromi forniscono ai piloti un posto dove guidare, e alle folle un posto per guardarli.
TEXT.Polish: Tor żużlowy daje zawodnikom miejsce do jazdy i daje miejsce dla tłumów by oglądać ich wyczyny.

TEXT.English: Battlebot Arenas are hi-tech battle rooms, for catering to a more advanced crowds.
TEXT.French: une Arène de Robots's are hi-tech battle rooms, for catering to a more advanced crowds.
TEXT.Italian: Le arene per robot sono arene progettate per il combattimento fra dispositivi hi-tech; attirano grandi folle.
TEXT.Polish: Areny Botów są najnowszymi polami bitwy,ponieważ dostarczają jeszcze większych wrażeń poddanym

TEXT.English: Winter Lodge's are a relaxing place for citizens to spend their time in a winter environment.
TEXT.Italian: Gli chalet invernali sono posti rilassanti in cui i cittadini spendono il loro tempo rilassandosi.
TEXT.Polish: Ośrodek Zimowy są relaksującym miejscem dla obywateli, gdzie mogą spędzić czas w otoczeniu zimy.

TEXT.English: Ski Resort's can only built on peaks, but provide extra happiness and income for cities that can build them.
TEXT.French: une Station de Sports d'hiver's can only built on peaks, but provide extra happiness and income for cities that can build them.
TEXT.Italian: Le stazioni sciistiche possono essere costruite solo in montagna; forniscono oro e felicità alla città in cui vengono costruite.

TEXT.English: Airfields attract small-time fliers and racing enthusiasts.
TEXT.French: un Aérodromes attract small time fliers and racing enthusiasts.
TEXT.Italian: I campi di volo attirano amatori del volo e amanti delle gare.

TEXT.English: TBD
Public Pool
TEXT.German: Öffentliches Schwimmbad
TEXT.Polish: Basen Publiczny

TEXT.English: Build a Public Pool to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piscine publique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur, la santé et la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Errichte ein öffentliches Schwimmbad und erhöhe die Zufriedenheit und die Gesundheit in der Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una piscina pubblica per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Buduj Baseny Publiczne by zwiększyć szczęście oraz zdrowie.

TEXT.English: Ancient Greeks and Romans built artificial pools for athletic training in the palaestras, for nautical games and for military exercises.
Basketball Court
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do koszykówki

TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Basketball[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un caampo da pallacanestro per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.

TEXT.English: Basketball is a team sport in which two teams of five players try to score points by throwing or "shooting" a ball through the top of a basketball hoop while following a set of rules. Basketball is one of the world's most popular and widely viewed sports.
Softball Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do softbolu

TEXT.English: Build a Softball Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Softball[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da softball per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Softball Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: The earliest known softball game was played in Chicago, Illinois on Thanksgiving Day, 1887. It took place at the Farragut Boat Club at a gathering to hear the outcome of the Yale University and Harvard University football game. When the score was announced and bets were settled, a Yale alumnus threw a boxing glove at a Harvard supporter. The Harvard fan grabbed a stick and swung at the rolled up glove. George Hancock, a reporter there, called out "Play ball!" and the game began, with the boxing glove tightened into a ball, a broom handle serving as a bat. This first contest ended with a score of 41–40. The ball, being soft, was fielded barehanded.
TEXT.Polish: Softball - gra podobna do baseballu, lecz rozgrywana na mniejszym boisku, większą piłką oraz lżejszą i grubszą pałką. Rywalizują ze sobą dwie drużyny po 9 zawodników. Główna część pola gry jest kwadratem o boku 18,3 m. W narożnikach umieszczone są bazy (jedna z baz to baza domowa). W grze używa się piłki o obwodzie blisko 30 cm (11 lub 12 cali w zależności od rodzaju rozgrywek ) i wadze 166-173 g oraz kija o długości około 86 cm i wadze około 1 kg. Mecz składa się z 7 inningów. W każdej z nich obie drużyny grają na przemian w ataku i w obronie. Drużyna atakująca odbija kijem piłkę rzuconą (od dołu) przez miotacza z drużyny przeciwnej.

TEXT.English: Skate Park
TEXT.Polish: Skatepark

TEXT.English: Build a Skate Park to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parc pour Skateboard[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci uno skate park per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Skate Park to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Skateboarding is an action sport which involves riding and performing tricks using a skateboard. A person who skateboards is most often referred to as a skateboarder, or colloquially within the skateboarding community, a skater.
TEXT.Polish: Skatepark to specjalny tor przeznaczony do uprawiania sportów ekstremalnych (jazda na deskorolce, hulajnodze BMX czy wyczynowa jazda na rolkach). W skateparku może znajdować się wiele przeszkód przeznaczonych do nauki trików. Do prywatnych skateparków można zwykle wejść za opłatą, podczas gdy publiczne skateparki zwykle są darmowe. Prywatne skateparki są często umieszczone wewnątrz budynków. Publiczne skateparki prawie zawsze dostępne są na świeżym powietrzu.

TEXT.English: Golf Course
TEXT.Polish: Pole Golfowe

TEXT.English: Build a Golf Course to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parcours de Golf[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un percorso da golf per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Golf Course to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Golf is a precision club and ball sport, in which competing players (or golfers) use many types of clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a golf course using the fewest number of strokes.
TEXT.Polish: Pole golfowe - obszar o powierzchni od kilku do kilkudziesięciu hektarów, porośnięty różnej długości przystrzyżoną trawą lub drzewami, służący do gry w golfa. Znajduje się na nim 9 (pole małe) lub 18 (pole pełnowymiarowe) kolejno ponumerowanych i odpowiednio rozmieszczonych dołków. Każdy dołek ma określoną liczbę wymaganych uderzeń (tzw. PAR), które wynosi (w zależności od długości dołka) 3, 4 lub 5. Liczbę PAR poszczególnych dołków sumuje się w PAR danego pola. Każdy z dołków ma przydzielony tzw. Stroke Index (zakres od 1 do 18), czyli liczbę określającą różnicę w trudności rozgrywania pomiędzy graczem scratch a graczem bogey.

TEXT.English: Bowling Alley
TEXT.Polish: Kręgielnia

TEXT.English: Build a Bowling Alley to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bowling[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un bowling per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Bowling Alley to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Bowling is a sport in which players attempt to score points by rolling a bowling ball along a flat surface, usually a wooden or synthetic surface, either into pins or to get close to a target ball. The most common types include ten-pin, nine-pin, candlepin, duckpin and five-pin bowling, as well as multiple outdoor variations.
TEXT.Polish: Kręgle (ang. bowling), rodzaj gry w kule, polegający na strącaniu nimi 9-10 ciężkich pionów (zwanych właśnie kręglami). Kula do kręgli (bowling) ma średnicę 160-218 mm. Znajdują się w niej dwa lub więcej otwory na palce. Parkiet ma 18 m długości, 1 m szerokości; po bokach znajdują się rowy uniemożliwiające powrót kuli, która wypadła z toru. Kręgle mają 38 cm wysokości i 12 cm szerokości. Waga pojedynczego kręgla powinna wynosić od 1,47 kg do 1,64 kg.

TEXT.English: Cricket Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do krykieta

TEXT.English: Build a Cricket Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Cricket[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da cricket per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cricket Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of 11 players on a field, at the centre of which is a rectangular 22-yard long pitch. One team bats, trying to score as many runs as possible while the other team bowls and fields, trying to dismiss the batsmen and thus limit the runs scored by the batting team.
TEXT.Polish: Krykiet - sport drużynowy, w którym mecze rozgrywane są między dwiema drużynami po jedenastu zawodników. Pochodzi zAnglii, gdzie podobna gra była znana już na przełomie XIII i XIVwieku.

TEXT.English: Rugby Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do rugby

TEXT.English: Build a Rugby Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Rugby[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da rugby per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Rugby Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Rugby football developed from a version of football played at Rugby School and was originally one of several versions of football played at English public schools during the 19th century.
TEXT.Polish: Do połowy XIX wieku historia wszystkich kodów futbolowych (piłki nożnej, rugby, futbolów amerykańskiego, australijskiego, gaelickiego i kanadyjskiego oraz ich odmian) jest wspólna. Początków rugby można doszukiwać się w grach popularnych w starożytności w basenie Morza Śródziemnego, choć warto wspomnieć że sporty z użyciem piłki istniały w różnych cywilizacjach i kulturach na całej Zemi. W Chinach grano w grę cuju już około 2300 lat temu. Jej reguły spisano między 206 a 220 r.n.e. Gra dotarła później do Korei (znana jako chuk-guk) i Japonii (pod nazwą kemari). Podobne gry mieli Eskimosi (Aqsaqtuk), Indianie (Pahsaheman), Aborygeni, czyMaorysi (Ki-o-rahi). Gumowej piłki używano w prekolumbijskiej Mezoameryce, choć lokalny sport przypominał raczej koszykówkę albo siatkówkę. Gry z piłką znali też Celtowie, choć trudno dziś określić, czy było to zapożyczenie od Rzymian, czy własna inwencja.

TEXT.English: Polo Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do gry w polo

TEXT.English: Build a Polo Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Polo[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da polo per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Polo Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Polo is a team sport played on horseback in which the objective is to score goals against an opposing team. Sometimes called, "The Sport of Kings", it was highly popularised by the British. Players score by driving a small white plastic or wooden ball into the opposing team's goal using a long-handled mallet.
TEXT.Polish: Polo - gra rozgrywana konno na trawiastym boisku przez dwie czteroosobowe drużyny, których gracze dążą, używając długich kijów tzw.malletów, do umieszczenia w bramce przeciwnika drewnianej, białej kuli, wielkości pomarańczy.

TEXT.English: Croquet Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko Do Krykieta

TEXT.English: Build a Croquet Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Croquet[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da croquet per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Croquet Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Croquet is a lawn game, played both as a recreational pastime and as a competitive sport. It involves hitting plastic or wooden balls with a mallet through wickets embedded into the grass playing court.
TEXT.Polish: Krykiet - sport drużynowy, w którym mecze rozgrywane są między dwiema drużynami po jedenastu zawodników. Pochodzi z Anglii, gdzie podobna gra była znana już na przełomie XIII i XIV wieku. Mecze krykietowe rozgrywane są na trawiastym boisku o zbliżonym do owalnego kształcie, w środku którego znajduje się płaski pas (ang. pitch - dosłownie: "murawa") długości 20,12 m. Na końcach pasa ustawione są bramki (ang. wicket) - trzy wbite w ziemię drewniane słupki (ang. stump - dosłownie: "pniak", "kijek"). Gracz jednej z drużyn rzuca twardą piłkę z korka obłożonego skórą, o obwodzie 224-229 mm, w kierunku przeciwległej bramki, tak aby w nią trafić, a gracz drugiej drużyny (ang. batsman) broni jej przed uderzeniem za pomocą drewnianego kija.

TEXT.English: Tennis Court
TEXT.Polish: Kort do tenisa

TEXT.English: Build a Tennis Court to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Court de Tennis[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da tennis per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Tennis Court to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Tennis is a sport usually played between two players (singles) or between two teams of two players each (doubles). Each player uses a racket that is strung to strike a hollow rubber ball covered with felt over a net into the opponent's court. Tennis is an Olympic sport and is played at all levels of society at all ages. The sport can be played by anyone who can hold a racket, including people in wheelchairs.
TEXT.Polish: Tenis, tenis ziemny - dyscyplina sportowa rozgrywana na korcie tenisowym, polegająca na przebijaniu rakietą tenisową piłki ponad lub obok siatki na pole przeciwnika. Może być rozgrywana pojedynczo (tzw. singel) lub w dwuosobowych zespołach zawodników jednej płci (debel) lub obu (mikst). Tenis należał do grona letnich dyscyplin olimpijskich w latach 1896-1924. Do ich programu powrócił w 1988.

TEXT.English: Hockey Rink
TEXT.Polish: Lodowisko Hokejowe

TEXT.English: Build a Hockey Rink to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Patinoire de Hockey[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da hockey per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hockey Rink to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Hockey is a family of sports in which two teams play against each other by trying to maneuver a ball or a puck into the opponent's goal using a hockey stick.
TEXT.Polish: Hokej na lodzie jest najbardziej popularny w krajach północnej półkuli, co wynika z uwarunkowań klimatycznych. Na terenach gdzie sezonowo (w czasie zimy) można pokryć dane miejsce lodem, tj. w Kanadzie, USA, Rosji,Czechach, Słowacji, Niemczech, Szwajcarii oraz w krajach nordyckich (Szwecja, Finlandia). Wraz z pojawieniem się lodowisk w zamkniętych halach sport ten można rozgrywać przez cały rok. Hokej na lodzie jest jednym z czterech najpopularniejszych sportów zawodowych w Ameryce Północnej. Na terenie Kanady oraz Stanów Zjednoczonych rozgrywana jest najważniejsza na świecie klubowa liga świata NHL. Jest to oficjalny zimowy sport narodowy Kanady, gdzie gra ta cieszy się ogromną popularnością.

TEXT.English: Volleyball Court
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do siatkówki

TEXT.English: Build a Volleyball Court to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Volleyball[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da pallavolo per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Volleyball Court to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Volleyball is a team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules.
TEXT.Polish: Piłka siatkowa, siatkówka - sport drużynowy, w którym (w tradycyjnej, klasycznej odmianie, tj. siatkówce halowej) uczestniczą dwa sześcioosobowe zespoły, w każdym: rozgrywający, atakujący, dwóch środkowych i dwóch przyjmujących oraz libero. Na boisku przebywa jednak tylko sześciu zawodników, libero zmienia się ze środkowym będącym w linii obrony, gdy drużyna przyjmuje zagrywkę.

TEXT.English: Soccer Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko Piłkarskie

TEXT.English: Build a Soccer Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Football[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo di calcio per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Soccer Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Soccer is a sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball.
TEXT.Italian: Il calcio è uno sport in cui due squadre composte da undici giocatori cercando di segnare dei gol utilizzando una sfera circolare.
TEXT.Polish: Boisko - nazwa boisko pochodzi od ludowego określenia płaskiej przestrzeni w środkowej części stodoły położonej między dwoma sąsiekami, miejsca młocki zboża, zwanego także bojewica, bojewisko, klepisko. Dziś boisko to miejsce przeznaczone do ćwiczeń gimnastycznych, gier, rozgrywek i zawodów sportowych.

TEXT.English: Boxing Ring
TEXT.Polish: Ring Bokserski

TEXT.English: Build a Boxing Ring to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ring de Boxe[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ring da boxe per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Boxing Ring to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Boxing is a combat sport in which two people engage in a contest using only their fists.
TEXT.Italian: La boxe è uno sport da combattimento in cui due persone cercano di avere la meglio l'uno sull'altro usando solo i loro pugni.
TEXT.Polish: Ring bokserski jest miejscem walk bokserskich lub walk w podobnych dyscyplinach (np. kick-boxing). Współczesny ring ma postać kwadratowego podwyższenia, otoczonego czterema równoległymi do podłoża linami, przyczepionymi do słupów narożnych w każdym rogu ringu. Obecnie zawodowe walki muszą mieć ring zgodny z międzynarodowym standardem, jednakże jest kilka różnych międzynarodowych standardów.

TEXT.English: Roller Derby Track
TEXT.Polish: Tor Wrotkarski

TEXT.English: Build a Roller Derby Track to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piste de Rollers[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una pista per pattini in linea per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Roller Derby Track to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Roller derby is a contact sport played by two teams of five members roller skating in the same direction around a track.
TEXT.Polish: Wrotkarstwo - dyscyplina sportowa (chętnie i często uprawiana dla celów typowo rekreacyjnych), pokrewna łyżwiarstwu. Do poruszania się wykorzystywane są tu specjalne "buty na kółkach". Wyróżnia się dwa typy wrotek - dwuśladowe (tradycyjne) i jednośladowe (tzw. łyżworolki/rolki/inline-skates). Z tych samych korzeni, co wrotkarstwo, wyłoniły się hulajnoga i deskorolkarstwo.

TEXT.English: Velodrome
TEXT.Polish: Welodrom

TEXT.English: Build a Velodrome to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vélodrome[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un velodromo per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Velodrome to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: A velodrome is an arena for track cycling. Modern velodromes feature steeply banked oval tracks, consisting of two 180-degree circular bends connected by two straights. The straights transition to the circular turn through a moderate easement curve.
TEXT.French: Le vélodrome est une surface aménagée circulaire pour l'entraînement et les compétitions de cyclisme sur piste. À l'origine, les courses de cyclisme sur route voyaient leur arrivée se disputer dans un vélodrome. Cela est de plus en plus rare, sauf dans quelques courses « classiques », comme Paris-Roubaix.
TEXT.Polish: Kolarstwo torowe uprawia się na rowerach torowych zbudowanych na kołach 28 calowych, podobnych do rowerów szosowych, ale o uproszczonej i mocno odchudzonej konstrukcji. Tory (zwane też czasem welodromami), na których uprawia się ten sport mają kształt zbliżony do bieżni lekkoatletycznych, na łukach są jednak mocno pochylone, aby można było na nich utrzymywać stałą prędkość.

TEXT.English: Surf Shop
TEXT.Polish: Sklep Surfingowy

TEXT.English: Build a Surf Shop to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boutique de Surf[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un negozio di articoli da surf per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Surf Shop to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Surfing is a surface water sport in which the wave rider, referred to as a "surfer," rides on the forward face of a wave, which is most often carrying the surfer towards shore. Waves suitable for surfing are found primarily in the ocean, but can be found in some lakes, in rivers in the form of a standing wave or tidal bore. Surfing can also be done in manmade sources such as wave pools and boat wakes.
TEXT.Polish: Surfing - jazda (ślizg) na przystosowanej do tego specjalnej desce, unoszonej przez czoło fali morskiej. Największy efekt osiąga się na przybrzeżnych falach oceanicznych. Deska wyposażona w żagiel służy do uprawiania windsurfingu, deski do uprawiania kitesurfingu napędzane są rodzajem latawca - paralotni. Jednym z rodzajów surfingu jest bodyboard, czyli ślizg na desce w pozycji leżącej.

TEXT.English: Sports Shop
TEXT.Polish: Sklep Sportowy

TEXT.English: Build a Sports Shop to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Magasin de Sports[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un negozio di articoli sportivi per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Sports Shop to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Sports equipment is a general term for any object used for sport or exercise.
TEXT.Polish: Sklep sprzedający akcesoria i ubrania sportowe.

TEXT.English: Lacrosse Field
TEXT.Polish: Boisko do Lacrosy

TEXT.English: Build a Lacrosse Field to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terrain de Crosse[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da lacrosse per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lacrosse Field to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Lacrosse is a team sport of Native American origin played using a small rubber ball and a long-handled stick called a crosse or lacrosse stick, mainly played in the United States and Canada. It is a contact sport which requires padding such as shoulder pads, gloves, helmets and sometimes even rib guards. The head of the lacrosse stick is strung with loose mesh designed to catch and hold the lacrosse ball and can also be strung with hard mesh.
TEXT.Polish: Lacrosse (fr. la crosse - zakrzywiony kij) - zespołowa gra sportowa pochodzenia indiańskiego, której zasady ostatecznie ustalono w pierwszej połowie XIX w. w Kanadzie (gdzie uznano ją za sport narodowy); rozgrywana na trawiastym boisku, polega na umieszczeniu za pomocą specjalnej, trójkątnej rakiety piłki w bramce przeciwnika; 1904 i 1908konkurencja olimpijska; uznawana za pierwowzór hokeja na lodzie

TEXT.English: Jai-Alai Court
TEXT.Polish: Kort do peloty

TEXT.English: Build a Jai-Alai Court to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Court de Jai-Alai[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo da Jai-Alai per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Jai-Alai Court to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Jai-alai is a sport involving a ball bounced off a walled space. It is a variety of Basque Pelota. The term, coined by Serafin Baroja in 1875, is also often loosely applied to the fronton (the open-walled playing area) where the sport is played.
TEXT.Polish: Pelota (bask. Pilota, lub Jai-alai) - gra znana w krajuBasków w Hiszpanii. Jest to rodzaj tenisarozgrywanego na boisku otoczonym ścianami, o które odbijana jest piłka.

TEXT.English: Curling Sheet
TEXT.Polish: Lodowisko Do Curlingu

TEXT.English: Build a Curling Sheet to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piste de Curling[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una pista da curling per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Curling Sheet to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: Curling is a sport in which players slide stones across a sheet of ice towards a target area which is segmented into four rings. It is related to bowls, boule and shuffleboard. Two teams, each of four players, take turns sliding heavy, polished granite stones, also called "rocks", across the ice curling sheet towards the house, a circular target marked on the ice.
TEXT.Polish: Curling - należy do zespołowych sportów precyzyjnych, podobnych do petanque czy bocce. Jest on rozgrywany na prostokątnej tafli lodu. W rywalizacji biorą udział dwie drużyny liczące po 4 zawodników. Do gry używa się kamieni, które są wypuszczane na lodzie w kierunku celu zwanego domem. Liczba przyznanych punktów zależy od liczby kamieni znajdujących się najbliżej środka domu. Poziom umiejętności, precyzja i złożoność wykonywanych zagrań oraz odpowiednia strategia sprawiają, że curling jest nazywany "szachami na lodzie".

TEXT.English: Humphrey Metrodome
TEXT.French: Métrodome H. Humphrey

TEXT.English: Build a Humphrey Metrodome to increase your cities happiness and health.
TEXT.French: Construisez le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Métrodome H. Humphrey[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur et la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci l'Humphrey Metrodome per incrementare la felicità e la salute della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Humphrey Metrodome to increase your cities happiness and health.

TEXT.English: The Hubert H. Humphrey Metrodome, commonly called the Metrodome, is a domed sports stadium in downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States. Opened in 1982, it replaced Metropolitan Stadium, which was on the current site of the Mall of America in Bloomington and Memorial Stadium on the University of Minnesota campus. The Metrodome is home to the National Football League's Minnesota Vikings, and the Big Ten's University of Minnesota Golden Gophers baseball team. The stadium was also the home of the Minnesota Twins from 1982 to 2009, the Minnesota Timberwolves in their 1989-1990 inaugural season and the Golden Gophers football team from 1982 to 2008. The football playing field has been known as Mall of America Field at the Hubert H. Humphrey Metrodome since October 2009.
TEXT.French: The Hubert H. Métrodome H. Humphrey, commonly called the Metrodome, is a domed sports stadium in downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States. Opened in 1982, it replaced Metropolitan Stadium, which was on the current site of the Mall of America in Bloomington and Memorial Stadium on the University of Minnesota campus. The Metrodome is home to the National Football League's Minnesota Vikings, and the Big Ten's University of Minnesota Golden Gophers baseball team. The stadium was also the home of the Minnesota Twins from 1982 to 2009, the Minnesota Timberwolves in their 1989-1990 inaugural season and the Golden Gophers football team from 1982 to 2008. The football playing field has been known as Mall of America Field at the Hubert H. Métrodome H. Humphrey since October 2009.

TEXT.English: Tourism increases gold, culture, happiness, crime, disease, air pollution and water pollution.
TEXT.French: Le Tourisme augmente la Richesse, la culture, le bonheur, la criminalité, les maladies, et les pollution de l'air et de l'eau.

TEXT.English: Tourism is an important, even vital, source of income for many countries.
TEXT.French: Le Tourisme est une importante source de revenus dans bien des pays.
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka - zjawisko przestrzennej ruchliwości ludzi, które związane jest z dobrowolną zmianą miejsca pobytu, środowiska i rytmu życia. Obejmuje całokształt stosunków i zjawisk związanych z ruchem turystycznym.

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 1)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 1)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 1)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 2)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 2)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 2)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 3)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 3)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 3)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 4)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 4)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 4)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 5)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 5)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 5)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 6)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 6)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 6)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 7)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 7)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 7)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 8)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 8)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 8)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 9)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 9)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 9)

TEXT.English: Tourism (Level 10)
TEXT.French: Tourisme (Niveau 10)
TEXT.Polish: Turystyka (Poziom 10)

TEXT.English: Palisade
TEXT.Polish: Palisada

TEXT.English: Early Defense, useful against Barbarians.
TEXT.Italian: Difesa primitiva, utile contro i barbari.

TEXT.English: Palisades are walls built of wood. Although stone walls were preferable, wood was abundant and easy to use, and a palisade could be erected in a fraction of the time a stone wall would take.
TEXT.French: une Palissades are walls built of wood. Although stone walls were preferable, wood was abundant and easy to use, and a palisade could be erected in a fraction of the time a stone wall would take.
TEXT.Italian: Le palizzate sono mura di legno. Nonostante le mura in pietra fossero migliori, spesso il legno era più abbondante e facile da utilizzare; inoltre, una palizzata poteva essere costruita molto più velocemente di un muro in pietra.
TEXT.Polish: Palisada, ostrokół, częstokół - element dawnego budownictwa obronnego w postaci ogrodzenia składającego się z drewnianych, zazwyczaj ostro zakończonych pali, wbitych jeden przy drugim, prosto lub ukośnie w ziemię spełniający rolę struktury zaporowej, defensywnej.

TEXT.English: Barricades
TEXT.German: Barrikaden
TEXT.Polish: Barykady

TEXT.English: Cheap defense, which eliminates a trade route. To the barricades.
TEXT.German: Billige Verteidigung, die einen Handelsweg eliminiert. Auf die Barrikaden.
TEXT.Italian: Difesa molto economica, che però elimina una rotta commerciale.

TEXT.English: The very first barricades in the streets of Paris, a feature of the French Revolution and urban rebellions ever since, went up on the Day of the Barricades, 12 May 1588, when an organized rebellion of Parisians forced Henri III from Paris, leaving it in the hands of the Catholic League. Wagons, timbers and hogsheads (barriques) were chained together to impede the movements of Swiss Guards and other forces loyal to the king. During the Parisian insurrection of June 1832, barricades were used. In Les Miserables, the building and defending of a barricade during this time was famously described. Barricades were also used at the end of the Paris Commune of 1871 and in May 1968 in France. A major aim of Haussmann's renovation of Paris under Napoleon III was to eliminate the potential of citizens to build barricades by widening streets into avenues too wide for barricades to block. Such terms as "go to the barricades" or "standing at the barricades" are used in various languages, especially in rousing songs of various radical movements, as metaphors for starting and participating in a revolution or civil war, even when no physical barricades are used.
TEXT.Italian: Le prime barricate per le strade di Parigi, una caratteristica della Rivoluzione francese e delle ribellioni urbane da allora, furono erette nella Giornata delle Barricate, il 12 Maggio 1588, quando una rivolta organizzata dai parigini cacciò Enrico III da Parigi, lasciando la città in mano alla Lega Cattolica. Carri, legni e botti venivano incatenati insieme per impedire i movimenti delle guardie svizzere e delle altre forze leali al re. Durante l'insurrezione parigina del giugno 1832 vennero utilizzate le barricate; nel racconto Les Miserables vengono descritte la costruzione e la difesa di una barricata proprio duarante questo evento storico. Le barricate sono stati utilizzate anche alla fine della Comune di Parigi del 1871 e nel maggio 1968. Uno dei principali obiettivi dell'aggiornamento di Parigi effettuato dal barone Haussmann di Parigi sotto Napoleone III era di eliminare il potenziale dei cittadini per costruire barricate, allargando le strade in viali troppo larghi per essere bloccati dalle barricate. Termini come "andare sulle barricate" o "in piedi sulle barricate" sono utilizzati in varie lingue, specialmente in canzoni trascinanti di vari movimenti radicali, come metafore per l'avvio e la partecipazione a una rivoluzione o una guerra civile, anche quando non vengono usate barricate fisiche.
TEXT.Polish: Barykada (fr. barricade) - doraźna fortyfikacja przegradzająca w całości przejazd danym szlakiem komunikacyjnym, zbudowana w miejscu uniemożliwiającym jego bezpośrednie obejście, zbudowana z materiałów dostępnych na miejscu lub zgromadzonych specjalnie w tym celu. Barykada z uwagi na jej charakter musi być broniona przed jej rozebraniem lub sforsowaniem przez przeciwnika.

TEXT.English: Cement Barrier
TEXT.German: Betonmauer
TEXT.Polish: Cementowa Bariera

TEXT.English: Heavy Defense. Reduces trade and increases anger.
TEXT.Italian: Difesa molto resistente; riduce il commercio e aumenta l'infelicità.

TEXT.English: Large, fortified walls made out of concrete are used as barriers against human traffic. Such walls commonly have checkpoints and heavily armed soldiers to prevent against trespass. The most famous examples are the Berlin Wall and the West Bank Barrier.
TEXT.Italian: Grandi mura fortificate in cemento che vengono usate come barriere contro il traffico. Solitamente esistono dei checkpoint sorvegliati da soldati pesantemente armati che permettono di attraversare queste mura. Gli esempi più famosi sono il Muro di Berlino e la Barriera di separazione israeliana.
TEXT.Polish: Bariera przeciwczołgowa - to zapora inżynieryjna budowane na kierunkach prawdopodobnego ruchu czołgów i innych wozów bojowych przeciwnika. Bariery swą konstrukcją są zbliżone do barykad.

TEXT.English: Towers provide defense; can be upgraded.
TEXT.French: Les Tours améliorent la défense. Elles peuvent être améliorées.
TEXT.Italian: Le torri forniscono una certa difesa; possono essere migliorate.
TEXT.Polish: Wieże zwiększają bezpieczeństwo, mogą być ulepszone.

TEXT.English: Frontier Outpost
TEXT.German: Grenzposten
TEXT.Polish: Posterunek Graniczny

TEXT.English: Outposts are structures commonly made of wood or stone. They serve as an early warning of approaching enemy forces.
TEXT.Italian: Gli avamposti sono strutture costruite in legno o pietra; sono delle postazioni di avvistamento per difendersi dagli attacchi nemici.
TEXT.Polish: Przejście graniczne - ustalone na drodze umów międzypaństwowych miejsce na granicy pomiędzy państwami służące do jej przekraczania zarówno przez podróżnych, jak i pojazdy.

TEXT.English: Fortified Outpost
TEXT.German: Befestigter Außenposten
TEXT.Polish: Umocniony Posterunek

TEXT.English: Outposts are structures commonly made of wood or stone. They serve as an early warning of approaching enemy forces.
TEXT.Italian: Gli avamposti sono strutture costruite in legno o pietra; sono delle postazioni di avvistamento per difendersi dagli attacchi nemici.
TEXT.Polish: Przejście graniczne - ustalone na drodze umów międzypaństwowych miejsce na granicy pomiędzy państwami służące do jej przekraczania zarówno przez podróżnych, jak i pojazdy.

TEXT.English: Watch Tower
TEXT.German: Beobachtungsturm
TEXT.Polish: Wieża Obserwacyjna

TEXT.English: Some of the earliest fortified stone structures were simple watch towers. From the watch tower a local lord could keep a large area in view.
TEXT.Italian: Alcune delle prime strutture fortificate in pietra erano semplici torri d'osservazioni; da una torre di osservazione un signore locale poteva tenere sotto controllo una vasta area.
TEXT.Polish: Wieża obserwacyjna - wieża przeznaczona do obserwacji otaczającego je terenu. Z reguły, wieże obserwacyjne, są sytuowana w najwyższym punkcie w okolicy. Potocznie, wieże obserwacyjne utożsamiana są z wieżami widokowymi, jako punkt widokowy sztucznie wyniesiony w terenie w celu umożliwienia obserwacji walorów widokowych i estetycznych terenu.

TEXT.English: Guard Tower
TEXT.German: Wachturm
TEXT.Polish: Wieża Strażnicza

TEXT.English: The defensive tower continued to evolve during the Middle Ages by getting stronger, taller, and better designed for fight defense. Whereas some watch towers had been square, guard towers were usually round to eliminate a sharp corner that could be knocked off. Fighting positions at the top of a guard tower were improved to protect defenders. Hoardings extended out from the top, allowing defenders to reach the bottom of the guard tower with missiles. Entrances to guard towers were made more elaborate and more easily defended.
TEXT.Italian: Le torri difensive continuarono ad evolversi durante il Medioevo diventando più resistenti, più alte e progettate meglio per le battaglie difensive. Mentre le torri d'osservazione poteva essere squadrate, le torri di guardia erano sempre arrotondate, in modo da eliminare gli spigoli vivi che potevano essere distrutti. I posti di combattimento in cima alla torre erano migliorati per proteggere i difensori; delle sporgenze si estendevano dalla cima, permettendo ai difensori di gettare materiali sui nemici ai piedi della torre. Le entrate della torre erano molto elaborate e facilmente difendibili.
TEXT.Polish: Wieża - konstrukcja o wymiarach poprzecznych znacznie mniejszych od wysokości, pracująca jako wspornikutwierdzony w fundamencie, obciążony działaniem wiatru w kierunku poziomym oraz obciążeniem grawitacyjnym. Wieże miały różne funkcje, szczególnie popularne były w architekturze średniowiecznej, przede wszystkim jako wieże obronne i kościelne - zarówno wolno stojące (kampanile, dzwonnice), jak i stanowiące część budynku kościoła. W średniowiecznym zamku występowała tzw. wieża ostatniej obrony (donżon).

TEXT.English: Keep Tower
TEXT.German: Wohnturm
TEXT.Polish: Donżon

TEXT.English: A keep is a strong central tower which is used as a dungeon or a fortress. Often, the keep is the most defended area of a castle, and as such may form the main habitation area, or contain important stores such as the armory, food, and the main water well, which would ensure survival during a siege.
TEXT.Italian: Un mastio è la torre centrale di un castello, usata come prigione o fortezza. Spesso il mastio è l'area più difesa del castello; per questo motivo contiene gli alloggi principali, l'armeria il cibo, il pozzo e tutto ciò che può aiutare a sopravvivere ad un assedio.
TEXT.Polish: Donżon (fr. donjon, ang. keep, niem. donjon) - wieża łącząca w sobie główne funkcje mieszkalne i obronne, przez co zamieszkiwana była w czasie pokoju. Często mylona z wieżą ostatecznej obrony typu stołp (zwanej też Bergfried), która służyła jedynie funkcji militarnej.

TEXT.English: Bombard Tower
TEXT.German: Bastion
TEXT.Polish: Baszta Bombardierska

TEXT.English: By the end of the Middle Ages the development of cannon had changed military engineering by making standard castles obsolete. Their high vertical walls particularly susceptible to direct cannon fire aimed at their base. Military engineers responded by building new structures that were less susceptible to cannon fire and by mounting cannon within these structures to augment their defensive positions along coasts, at important river crossings, and at other strategic points. These new bombard towers swept the approaches to harbors and towns, making them more difficult to attack.
TEXT.Italian: Alla fine del Medioevo lo sviluppo dei cannoni aveva reso i castelli obsoleti; le loro alte mura verticali erano molto suscettibili ai colpi di cannone che venivano sparati alla base della mura. I genieri militari crearono quindi strutture più resistenti ai colpi di cannone, equipaggiandole con delle bombarde per fortificare le postazioni difensive lungo coste, fiumi e altri punti strategici. Queste nuove torri con bombarde proteggevano gli accessi ai porti e alle città, rendendone l'attacco molto più difficile.

TEXT.English: Artillery Battery
TEXT.German: Artilleriegeschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Artyleryjska

TEXT.English: The term "artillery" is used to describe any weapon that throws large missiles and requires more than one person to operate. In Civilization IV, the artillery technology refers specifically to the invention and production of large and powerful breech-loading weapons that fire shells rather than balls. Production of these weapons began in the latter half of the 19th Century. [PARAGRAPH:2]Artillery is defined in a number of ways. One is by the weapon's trajectory: a "direct fire" weapon has a relatively flat trajectory, while an "indirect-fire" weapon has a high arc, allowing the missile to be dropped on targets behind walls, hills or even mountains. Artillery is also defined by its mode of transport; some are "fixed" weapons that cannot be moved, others are "towed" by separate vehicles, and others are "self-propelled." [PARAGRAPH:2]Today's artillery is extremely lethal. The weapons can fire missiles at targets miles away, their targets spotted from airplane or even satellite. Artillery shells may contain high explosives, shrapnel, fueled-air explosives, mines, or even poison gas. The primary limitation of artillery in modern warfare is its relative slowness; the big guns cannot keep pace with the fast-moving armor and mechanized infantry forces. Jet planes are often used in artillery's traditional role now.
TEXT.French: Le terme "artillerie" désigne toute arme tirant de gros projectiles et dont le fonctionnement nécessite plus d'une personne. Dans Civilization IV, la technologie de l'artillerie fait spécifiquement référence à l'invention et à la production de canons à culasse de grandes tailles, tirant des obus et non des boulets. La production de ce type d'armes a commencé au cours de la deuxième moitié du XIXe siècle [PARAGRAPH:2]L'artillerie se définit de diverses manières. L'une d'entre elles est la trajectoire de l'arme: un canon à "tir direct" a une trajectoire relativement plate, alors qu'une arme à "tir indirect" a une trajectoire parabolique, ce qui permet au projectile de passer par-dessus des murailles, des collines, voire des montagnes. L'artillerie se définit aussi par son mode de transport: certains canons sont "fixes" et ne peuvent être déplacés. D'autres sont "tractés" par des véhicules distincts. Enfin, il existe des canons "autotractés." [PARAGRAPH:2]L'artillerie contemporaine est extrêmement meurtrière. Les pièces d'artillerie peuvent tirer sur des cibles situées à des kilomètres, ces dernières étant repérées par des avions, voire des satellites. Les obus d'artillerie peuvent contenir des explosifs puissants, des shrapnels, des charges thermobariques, des mines et même du gaz toxique. La principale limite imposée par l'artillerie moderne est sa relative lenteur. Les grosses pièces d'artillerie ne peuvent pas suivre le rythme des chars rapides ou de l'infanterie motorisée. Ainsi, le rôle traditionnel de l'artillerie est souvent tenu par des avions à réaction.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff "Artillerie" umfasst alle großkalibrigen Geschütze, für deren Bedienung mehrere Personen erforderlich sind. In Civilization IV konzentriert sich die Artillerie auf die Erfindung und Entwicklung schwerer Hinterladerwaffen, die anstelle von Kanonenkugeln Mantelgeschosse abfeuern. Die Produktion derartiger Waffen setzte in der zweiten Hälfte des 19. Jahrhunderts ein. [PARAGRAPH:2]Es gibt mehrere Arten, Artilleriewaffen zu definieren. Typisch für ein Artilleriegeschütz ist seine flache Flugbahn. Es feuert also "direkt" auf ein Ziel, während das Geschoss einer "indirekten" Waffen eine steile Flugbahn beschreibt und auch auf Ziele hinter Mauern, Hügeln oder Bergen abgefeuert werden kann. Darüber hinaus gibt es stationäre Artilleriestellungen und mobile bzw. von Fahrzeugen geschleppte Artilleriegeschütze.[PARAGRAPH:2]Moderne Artilleriegeschütze sind satellitengestützte Waffen, die auch kilometerweit entfernte Ziele mit tödlicher Präzision neutralisieren können. Moderne Artilleriegranaten enthalten Sprengstoff, Schrapnelle, Minen oder Giftgas. Der Hauptnachteil der Artillerie ist ihre Trägheit, da die schweren Waffen Panzern und mobilen Infanterieverbänden nur wenig entgegensetzen können.
TEXT.Italian: Il termine "artiglieria" viene utilizzato per descrivere qualsiasi arma in grado di lanciare grandi proiettili e che necessiti di almeno due persone per essere utilizzata. In Civilization IV, la tecnologia dell'artiglieria si riferisce in particolar modo all'invenzione e alla produzione di potenti armi a retrocarica in grado di sparare proiettili, invece di palle. La produzione di queste armi cominciò nella seconda metà del XIX secolo. [PARAGRAPH:2]L'artiglieria può essere definita in diversi modi e uno di questi riguarda la traiettoria: un'arma da "fuoco diretto" possiede una traiettoria diritta, mentre un "fuoco indiretto" si genera con un ampio arco, in modo da poter colpire gli obiettivi nascosti dietro mura, colline e addirittura montagne. Un'altra caratteristica dell'artiglieria è il modo in cui viene trasportata: alcune armi sono "fisse" e non possono essere spostate, mentre altre vengono "trainate" da altri mezzi o sono addirittura "autonome". [PARAGRAPH:2]L'artiglieria odierna è estremamente letale: queste armi possono sparare missili su bersagli lontani chilometri, identificati da foto aeree o satellitari. I proiettili di artiglieria possono contenere esplosivi, frammenti di metallo, composti chimici che detonano a contatto con l'aria, mine e addirittura gas velenoso. Nella guerra moderna, uno dei problemi maggiori dell'artiglieria è la lentezza negli spostamenti: queste potenti armi, infatti, non possono stare al passo con le unità mobili di fanteria corazzata e meccanizzata.
TEXT.Spanish: El término "artillería" se emplea para referirse a cualquier arma que arroje proyectiles de gran tamaño y requiera una dotación de más de una persona. En Civilization IV, la tecnología de artillería hace referencia específicamente a la invención de grandes y potentes armas de retrocarga que disparan obuses en lugar de bolas metálicas. La producción de estas armas se inició en la segunda mitad del siglo XIX. [PARAGRAPH:2]La artillería puede definirse de varias maneras. Una de ellas es la trayectoria de los proyectiles: un arma de "fuego directo" lanza sus proyectiles en una trayectoria relativamente recta, mientras que un arma de "fuego indirecto" utiliza un arco mayor, que permite que el proyectil alcance objetivos situados detrás de murallas, colinas e incluso montañas. La artillería se define también por su forma de desplazamiento: hay armas "fijas", que no pueden moverse; hay otras "móviles", transportadas por vehículos; y las hay "autopropulsadas". [PARAGRAPH:2]La artillería moderna es extremadamente letal. Los cañones pueden disparar a varios kilómetros de distancia contra objetivos localizados por avión o incluso por satélite. Los proyectiles pueden contener explosivos de gran potencia, metralla, explosivos atmosféricos e incluso gases venenosos. La principal limitación de la artillería moderna es su relativa lentitud; los grandes cañones no pueden desplazarse con la misma rapidez que las veloces fuerzas blindadas y de infantería mecanizada. En la actualidad, el papel de la artillería está encomendado en gran medida a los aviones a reacción.
TEXT.Polish: Forteczna bateria artyleryjska - dzieło obronne, przeważnie o narysie prostokątnym, w którym wał czołowy tworzą stanowiska artylerii oddzielone poprzecznicami, w których mogą znajdować się schrony pogotowia.

TEXT.English: Auto-Cannon Battery
TEXT.German: Maschinenkanonen-Geschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Dział Automatycznych

TEXT.English: An autocannon is a rapid-fire projectile weapon firing a shell as opposed to the bullet fired by a machine gun. Autocannon often have a larger caliber than a machine gun (i.e., 20 mm or greater). Usually, autocannons are smaller than a field gun or other artillery, and are mechanically loaded for a faster rate of fire. They can use a variety of ammunition: common shells include high-explosive dual-purpose types (HEDP), any variety of armour-piercing (AP) types, such as composite rigid (APCR) or discarding sabot types (APDS).
TEXT.Italian: Un cannone automatico è un'arma che spara palle ad alta velocità, analogamente ad una matrice che utilizza però i proiettili; i cannoni automatici hanno quindi un calibro maggiore rispetto alle mitragliatrci (ad esempio, 20 mm o più). Solitamente sono più piccoli delle artiglierie da campo e hanno meccanismi di ricarica automatici per poter sparare più in fretta. Possono usare diversi tipi di proiettili: proiettili esplosivi (HEDP), proiettili perforanti (AP), composti rigidi (APCR) o proiettili incendiari (APDS).
TEXT.Polish: Armata automatyczna - armata, w której czynności związane z przeładowaniem są wykonywane kosztem energii gazów prochowych lub dzięki wykorzystaniu energii z zewnętrznegosilnika.

TEXT.English: Missile Battery
TEXT.German: Raketengeschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Rakietowa

TEXT.English: Command guidance is a type of missile guidance in which a ground station or aircraft relay signals to a guided missile via radio (or possibly through a wire connecting the missile to the launcher) and tell the missile where to steer in order to intercept its target. Additionally, it is possible to send a command to the missile to detonate, even if the missile itself has a fuze or fuzes. Typically, the system giving the guidance commands is tracking both the target and the missile or missiles via radar. It determines the position and velocity of the target and the position and velocity of the missile and calculates whether their paths will intersect. If not, the guidance system will relay commands to the missile(s), telling them to move their fins in such a way to steer themselves in the direction necessary for them to end up on an interception course with the target. If the target maneuvers, the guidance system can notice this and update the missiles' course continuously to counteract the maneuvering. If the missile passes close to the target, either its own proximity or contact fuze will detonate the warhead, or the guidance system can estimate when the missile will pass near the target and send a detonation signal.
TEXT.Italian: Il comando di guida è un tipo di guida dei missili in cui una stazione di terra o aerea trasmettono segnali per guidare un missile via radio (o, eventualmente, attraverso un filo che collega il missile al lanciatore) e dire al missile dove dirigersi al fine di intercettare il suo obiettivo. Inoltre, è possibile inviare al missile il comando di detonare, anche il missile ha un dispositivo di innesco autonomo. In genere, il sistema che dà i comandi di guida monitora sia la destinazione, sia il missile o i missili tramite radar; determina la posizione e la velocità del bersaglio e la posizione e la velocità del missile e calcola se i loro percorsi si intersecano. In caso contrario, il sistema di guida inoltrerà i comandi al missile, dicendogli di muovere le alette in modo tale da orientarlo nella direzione necessaria per di intercettare il bersaglio. Se il bersaglio si sposta, il sistema di guida può notare questo e aggiornare il percorso del missile continuamente per contrastare la manovra. Se il missile passa vicino al bersaglio, la spoletta di vicinanza o quella di contatto faranno esplodere la testata; oppure il sistema di guida è in grado di stimare quando il missile passerà vicino al bersaglio e inviare un segnale di detonazione.
TEXT.Polish: Artyleryjski pododdział ogniowy w batalionie lub pułku ogólnowojskowym (np. czołgów lub wojsk zmechanizowanych) pełniący w nim rolę np. osłony przeciwlotniczej;

TEXT.English: Railgun Battery
TEXT.German: Schienenkanonen-Geschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Dział Gaussa

TEXT.English: A railgun is an entirely electrical gun that accelerates a conductive projectile along a pair of metal rails using the same principles as the homopolar motor. Railguns use two sliding or rolling contacts that permit a large electric current to pass through the projectile. This current interacts with the strong magnetic fields generated by the rails and this accelerates the projectile.
TEXT.Italian: Un cannone elettromagnetico (detto anche railgun, o cannone a rotaia) è un'arma elettrica che accelera un proettile conduttivo lungo una coppia di rotaie metalliche usando dei campi magnetici; questi cannoni utilizzano dei contatti rotanti che permettono a grandi quantità di corrente di passare attraverso il proiettile, che viene accelerato dall'interazione della corrente con il forte campo magnetico.
TEXT.Polish: Najprostszy (jednostopniowy) coilgun działa według zasad podanych powyżej, tzn. wyposażony jest w jedną cewkę. Jednak z uwagi na fakt, iż efektywna praca może być wykonywana tylko wówczas, gdy pocisk porusza się, stosuje się konstrukcje wielostopniowe, wyposażone w kilka cewek. Przyśpieszając już wstępnie rozpędzony pocisk można uzyskać wyższą sprawność. Wyzwolenie rozładowania kondensatorów przez kolejne cewki może odbywać się na podstawie upływu czasu (co wymaga dokładnego dopasowania działa do konkretnego rodzaju pocisków) lub na podstawie badania aktualnego położenia pocisku w lufie. Ten ostatni pomiar wykonywany jest zazwyczaj przez fotokomórki, detektory napięcia indukowanego w dodatkowej cewce przez przelatujący pocisk lub poprzez mechaniczne styki zwierane przez pocisk.

TEXT.English: Laser Battery
TEXT.German: Lasergeschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Artylerii Laserowej

TEXT.English: Laser beams are famously employed as weapon systems in science fiction, but actual laser weapons are only beginning to enter the market. The general idea of laser-beam weaponry is to hit a target with a train of brief pulses of light. The rapid evaporation and expansion of the surface causes shockwaves that damage the target. The power needed to project a high-powered laser beam of this kind is difficult for current mobile power technology. Public prototypes are chemically-powered gas dynamic lasers.
TEXT.Italian: Le armi laser sono molto diffuse nella fantascienza, ma attualmente le armi laser devono ancora essere messe sul mercato. L'idea base delle armi al laser è di colpire un bersaglio con brevi impulsi di luce; l'espansione e l'evaporazione della superficie colpoita causano delle onde d'urto che danneggiano il bersaglio. I livelli di energia necessari per queste armi sono attualmente difficili da realizzare per un dispositivo portatile; i primi prototipi utilizzano laser basati su reazioni chimiche.
TEXT.Polish: Systemy laserowe są zdolne do uwalniania skoncentrowanej energii w postaci wiązki świetlnej w bardzo krótkim przedziale czasu. Powoduje to, iż cała energia jest wyzwalana w bardzo krótkim czasie, co przy prędkości światła powoduje, iż praktycznie jest niemożliwe uniknięcie trafienia z takiej broni. Laser jako broń energetyczna jest najmniej rozpowszechniony - dopiero wprowadzany jedynie w USA na platformach powietrznych (Airborne Laser), aczkolwiek jest jednym z ulubionych tematów twórczości science-fiction. Lasery mniejszej mocy stosowane są też do niszczenia układów optycznych pojazdów. Prowadzone są prace nad laserami mogącymi krótkotrwale oślepiać żołnierzy. Używanie broni trwale oślepiającej jest zabronione przez IV protokół dodatkowy do Konwencji ONZ z 1980 roku. Dzięki technologii Spectral Beam Combining w 2014 osiągnięto moc lasera 30 kW, planowano prace nad wersją osiągającą moc 100 kW. Tactical High Energy Laser osiąga moc 3 MW.

TEXT.English: Anti-Matter Battery
TEXT.German: Antimaterie-Geschütz
TEXT.Polish: Bateria Dział Antymaterii

TEXT.English: In particle physics, antimatter is the extension of the concept of the antiparticle to matter, where antimatter is composed of antiparticles in the same way that normal matter is composed of particles. For example, an antielectron (a positron, an electron with a positive charge) and an antiproton (a proton with a negative charge) could form an antihydrogen atom in the same way that an electron and a proton form a normal matter hydrogen atom. Furthermore, mixing matter and antimatter would lead to the annihilation of both in the same way that mixing antiparticles and particles does, thus giving rise to high-energy photons (gamma rays) or other particle-antiparticle pairs. There is considerable speculation as to why the observable universe is apparently almost entirely matter, whether there exist other places that are almost entirely antimatter instead, and what might be possible if antimatter could be harnessed, but at this time the apparent asymmetry of matter and antimatter in the visible universe is one of the greatest unsolved problems in physics. The process by which this asymmetry between particles and antiparticles developed is called baryogenesis.
TEXT.Polish: Pododdział stanowiący zazwyczaj część składową dywizjonu lub pułku artylerii (np. bateria artylerii, bateria artylerii przeciwlotniczej, bateria moździerzy) lub rakiet (bateria rakietowa). Jest ona uzbrojona w działa samobieżne, holowane lub wyrzutnie rakiet. Składa się zwykle z pododdziału dowodzenia i plutonów ogniowych. Rozmieszcza się ją na jednym stanowisku ogniowym (stanowisku startowym) lub plutonami, niekiedy nawet poszczególnymidziałonami. Może wykonywać jedno lub więcej zadań ogniowych - zależnie od liczby dział (wyrzutni) i rodzaju amunicji (konwencjonalna, jądrowa). Może strzelać z zakrytych (ogniem pośrednim) lub odkrytych (ogniem na wprost) stanowisk ogniowych;

TEXT.English: Earth Wall
TEXT.Polish: Wał Ziemny

TEXT.English: Build an Earth Wall to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mur en Terre[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
