TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura in terra per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Prosty rodzaj murów zbudowanych z usypanej i wzmocnionej palami ziemi.

TEXT.English: Rammed-earth walls are simple to construct, incombustible, thermally massive, strong, and durable. They can be labour-intensive to construct without machinery, however, and they are susceptible to water damage if inadequately protected or maintained. Rammed-earth buildings are found on every continent except Antarctica, in a range of environments that includes the temperate and wet regions of northern Europe, semiarid deserts, mountain areas and the tropics. The availability of useful soil and a building design appropriate for local climatic conditions are the factors that favour its use.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Earth Wall to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Pit Traps
TEXT.Polish: Dziura-pułapka

TEXT.English: Trapping pits are deep pits dug into the ground, or built from stone, in order to trap animals. European rock drawings and cave paintings reveal that the elk and moose have been hunted since the stone age using trapping pits. In Northern Scandinavia one can still find remains of trapping pits used for hunting elk, reindeer, wolves and bears. These pits, which can measure up to 4 x 7 m in plan and be up to several metres deep, would have been camouflaged with branches and leaves. They would have had steep sides lined with planks, making it impossible for the animal to escape once it had fallen in. When the animal had fallen into the pit, it would either be killed by sharpened sticks pointed upwards from the bottom of the pit, or in the case of pits without these sticks, by hunters waiting nearby. [TAB]Pits are also dug as part of battlefield so that the defending army's terrain is more easily defended.
TEXT.Polish: Wilczy-dół lub wilkownia, w dokumencie z r. 1287 "jama" - samołówka na wilki. Zwykle w miejscu, gdzie wilki przychodziły, a często przy drogach krzyżowych kopano w ziemi dół 7 - 8 łokci głęboki a 4 - 5 szeroki, którego ściany wykładano gładkimi dylami, żeby wilk złapany wykopać się z niego nie mógł. Całą jamę zakrywał krąg upleciony z łozy, umocowany niby na osi na idącym przez jego środek drążku, przyprószony dla oszukania zwierza słomą i ziemią. Na środku tego kręgu przywiązywano jako przynętę: gęś, prosię lub owcę a od strony końców drążka, leżących na brzegach wilczo-dołu, dawano zagrodzenie, tak żeby wilk musiał iść taką stroną do przynęty, gdzie stąpiwszy przedniemi nogami zapadał się w wądół. Wilk w tej jamie stawał się pokornym i stąd powstało przysłowie: "Potulny jak wilk w jamie". Podobne samołówki urządzano jeszcze w puszczach na żubry i niedźwiedzie, zwane dołami żubrowymi i dołami niedźwiedzimi.

TEXT.English: Mechanical Traps
TEXT.Polish: Mechaniczne Pułapki

TEXT.English: Probably most commonly associated with trapping, the foothold trap is made up of two jaws, one or two springs, and a trigger in the middle which is usually a round pan. When the animal steps on the trigger the trap closes around the foot, preventing the animal from escaping. Usually some kind of lure is used to position the animal, or the trap is set on an animal trail. Foothold traps set for beaver, mink, river otter, and muskrat are positioned in shallow water along the shores and banks of rivers, lakes and ponds. Sometimes the trap is attached to a weight sunk in deeper water. The animal, when caught by the foot, tries to escape by diving into deep water and drowns. Traditionally, these traps had tightly closing jaws to make sure the animal stayed in place. These traps are made in various sizes from catching weasels to bears. At one time traps for wolves and bears had rounded teeth on the jaws to prevent escape.
TEXT.Polish: Pułapka - urządzenie służące do chwytania, także zasadzka, podstęp

TEXT.English: Landmines
TEXT.Polish: Pole Minowe

TEXT.English: A land mine is usually a victim-triggered explosive device which is intended to damage its target via blast and/or fragments. The name originates from the practice of mining, where tunnels were dug under enemy fortifications or forces. These tunnels ("mines") were first collapsed to destroy fortifications above, and later filled with explosives and detonated. Land mines generally refer to devices specifically manufactured for this purpose, as distinguished from improvised explosive devices ("IEDs"). The use of land mines is controversial because they are indiscriminate weapons, harming soldier and civilian alike. They remain dangerous after the conflict in which they were deployed has ended, killing and injuring civilians and rendering land impassable and unusable for decades. To make matters worse, many factions have not kept accurate records (or any at all) of the exact locations of their minefields, making removal efforts painstakingly slow. These facts pose serious difficulties in many developing nations where the presence of mines hampers resettlement, agriculture, and tourism. The International Campaign to Ban Landmines campaigned successfully to prohibit their use, culminating in the 1997 Convention on the Prohibition of the Use, Stockpiling, Production and Transfer of Anti-Personnel Mines and on their Destruction, known informally as the Ottawa Treaty. As of 2007, a total of 158 nations have agreed to the treaty. Thirty-seven countries have not agreed to the ban, including China, India, Israel, Pakistan, Russia and the United States.
TEXT.French: A land mine is usually a victim-triggered explosive device which is intended to damage its target via blast and/or fragments. The name originates from the practice of mining, where tunnels were dug under enemy fortifications or forces. These tunnels ("mines") were first collapsed to destroy fortifications above, and later filled with explosives and detonated. Land mines generally refer to devices specifically manufactured for this purpose, as distinguished from improvised explosive devices ("IEDs"). The use of land mines is controversial because they are indiscriminate weapons, harming soldier and civilian alike. They remain dangerous after the conflict in which they were deployed has ended, killing and injuring civilians and rendering land impassable and unusable for decades. To make matters worse, many factions have not kept accurate records (or any at all) of the exact locations of their minefields, making removal efforts painstakingly slow. These facts pose serious difficulties in many developing nations where the presence of mines hampers resettlement, agriculture, and tourism. The International Campaign to Ban un Champ de mines campaigned successfully to prohibit their use, culminating in the 1997 Convention on the Prohibition of the Use, Stockpiling, Production and Transfer of Anti-Personnel Mines and on their Destruction, known informally as the Ottawa Treaty. As of 2007, a total of 158 nations have agreed to the treaty. Thirty-seven countries have not agreed to the ban, including China, India, Israel, Pakistan, Russia and the United States.
TEXT.Polish: Pole minowe - w lądowych działaniach minowych określony obszar, na którym rozstawiono miny. W morskiej wojnie minowej obszar wodny, na którym ustawiono miny według ustalonego schematu albo bez takiego schematu.

TEXT.English: Booby Traps
TEXT.Polish: Improwizowane Pułapki

TEXT.English: A booby trap is a trap designed to kill or severely injure a human. As the word trap implies, they often have some form of bait designed to lure the victim towards it. However, in other cases the device is placed on busy roads or is triggered when the victim performs some type of everyday action e.g. opening a door, picking something up or switching something on. Booby traps should not be confused with mantraps which are designed to catch a person. Lethal booby traps are often used in warfare, particularly guerilla warfare, and traps designed to cause injury or pain are also sometimes used by criminals wanting to protect drugs or other illicit property, and by some owners of legal property who wish to protect it from theft. Booby traps which merely cause discomfort or embarrassment are a popular form of practical joke.
TEXT.Polish: Proste pułapki wykorzystujące materiały dostępne w naturze.

TEXT.English: Robotic Traps
TEXT.Polish: RoboPułapki

TEXT.English: Robotic traps can vary from dog-sized hunter-killers buried underground to swarms of hostile nanobots. Such traps can be easily programmed to tell friend from foe.
TEXT.Polish: Pułapki składające się z setek zagrzebanych w ziemi małych robotów-zabójców.

TEXT.English: Traps provide minor defense, but cause growth problems. They are good for border cities near dangerous opponents.
TEXT.French: Les pièges vous procurent un bonus de défense, mais causent des problèmes de croissance. Ils sont surtout utiles dans les villes frontières, près de vos plus dangereux adversaires.
TEXT.Italian: Le trappole aumentano le difese della tua città, ma possono causare dei problemi alla crescita della popolazione; costruiscile solo nelle città di confine, vicino a nazioni pericolose.

TEXT.English: Electric Fence
TEXT.French: Clôture Electrique
TEXT.Polish: Elektryczne Ogrodzenie

TEXT.English: Build an Electric Fence to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cloture Electrique[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un recinto elettrificato per proteggere la tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Electric Fence to protect your city.

TEXT.English: An electric fence is a barrier that uses electric shocks to deter animals or people from crossing a boundary. The voltage of the shock may have effects ranging from uncomfortable, to painful or even lethal. Most electric fencing is used today for agricultural fencing and other forms of animal control purposes, though it is frequently used to enhance security of sensitive areas, and places exist where lethal voltages are used.
TEXT.Polish: Porażenie prądem elektrycznym jest niekiedy wywoływane w sposób zamierzony. Wykorzystywane jest m.in. w ogrodzeniach pastwisk (elektryczny pastuch), jako jeden ze sposobów ogłuszania zwierząt przed ubojem w rzeźni, a także w medycynie (terapia elektrowstrząsowa, przezskórna stymulacja nerwów, defibrylacja, kardiowersja).

TEXT.English: Wireless Electric Fence
TEXT.French: Barrière Electrique Immatérielle
TEXT.Polish: Ogrodzenie Elektryczne Bezprzewodowe

TEXT.English: Build a Wireless Electric Fence to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cloture Electrique sans fils[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un recinto elettrificato wireless per proteggere la tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Wireless Electric Fence to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Wireless power or wireless energy transmission is the transmission of electrical energy from a power source to an electrical load without man-made conductors. Wireless transmission is useful in cases where interconnecting wires are inconvenient, hazardous, or impossible. The problem of wireless power transmission differs from that of wireless telecommunications, such as radio. In the latter, the proportion of energy received becomes critical only if it is too low for the signal to be distinguished from the background noise. With wireless power, efficiency is the more significant parameter. A large part of the energy sent out by the generating plant must arrive at the receiver or receivers to make the system economical.
TEXT.Polish: Ogrodzenie wykorzystujące bezprzewodową elektyczność jako czynnik grodzący.

TEXT.English: Metamaterial Walls
TEXT.French: Remparts en Métamateriau
TEXT.Polish: Mury z MetaMateriału

TEXT.English: Build a Metamaterial Walls to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Remparts en Méta-materiaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura in metamateriali per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Metamaterial Walls to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Metamaterials are artificial materials engineered to have properties that may not be found in nature. They are assemblies of multiple individual elements fashioned from conventional microscopic materials such as metals or plastics, but the materials are usually arranged in periodic patterns. Metamaterials gain their properties not from their composition, but from their exactingly-designed structures. Their precise shape, geometry, size, orientation and arrangement can affect the waves of light or sound in an unconventional manner, creating material properties which are unachievable with conventional materials. These metamaterials achieve desired effects by incorporating structural elements of sub-wavelength sizes, i.e. features that are actually smaller than the wavelength of the waves they affect.
TEXT.Polish: Mur obronny - ciągła konstrukcja warowna w postaci muruwykonanego z kamienia lub cegły. Podstawowa część każdej murowanej fortyfikacji.

TEXT.English: Superstrong Alloy Walls
TEXT.French: Remparts en Alliage Super-résistant
TEXT.Polish: Mury ze SuperStopu

TEXT.English: Build a Superstrong Alloy Walls to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Remparts en Alliage Super-résistant[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura in leghe superresistenti per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Superstrong Alloy Walls to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Superstrong Alloys are alloys that are at least twice as strong as Steel or Titanium.
TEXT.Italian: Le leghe superresistenti sono leghe aventi una resistenza almeno doppia rispetto all'acciaio o al titanio.
TEXT.Polish: Mury wykonane z super silnego materiału - SuperStopu.

TEXT.English: Megastrong Alloy Walls
TEXT.French: Remparts en Alliage Mega-résistant
TEXT.Polish: Mur z MegaStopu

TEXT.English: Build a Megastrong Alloy Walls to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Remparts en Alliage Mega-résistant[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura in leghe ultraresistenti per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Megastrong Alloy Walls to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Megastrong Alloys are alloys that can withstand anti-matter attacks.
TEXT.Italian: Le leghe ultraresistenti sono leghe in grado di resistere ai colpi delle armi ad antimateria.

TEXT.English: Nanobot Walls
TEXT.French: Remparts de Nanobots
TEXT.Polish: NanoMury

TEXT.English: Build a Nanobot Walls to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Remparts de Nanobots[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura di nanobot per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nanobot Walls to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Nanobot Walls are self repairing walls made of microscopic robots.
TEXT.French: Remparts de Nanobots are self repairing walls made of microscopic robots.
TEXT.Italian: I nanobot sono microscopici robot in grado di riparare autonomamente i danni alle difese.

TEXT.English: Smart Dust Walls
TEXT.French: Remparts de poussière IA
TEXT.Polish: Mury z NanoPyłu

TEXT.English: Build a Smart Dust Walls to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Remparts de poussière IA[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle mura di nanomacchine intelligenti per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Smart Dust Walls to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Smart Dust Walls are self repairing walls made of microscopic robots. They can also repair other fortifications.
TEXT.French: Remparts de poussière IA are self repairing walls made of microscopic robots. They can also repair other fortifications.
TEXT.Italian: Le nanomacchine intelligenti sono ancora meglio dei nanobot; oltre a riparare sè stesse, possono anche riparare le altre fortificazioni.
TEXT.Polish: Mury zbudowane z nanobotów i nanomateriałów.

TEXT.English: Bee Bombs
TEXT.French: Bombes d'insectes
TEXT.Polish: Bomby Pszczele

TEXT.English: Build a Bee Bombs to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bombes d'insectes[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci delle bombe con api per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Bee Bombs to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Bee Bombs are bee filled clay pots that are thrown at the enemy to confusion in enemy soldiers and sometimes they decided to withdraw from battle.
TEXT.French: Bombes d'insectes are bee filled clay pots that are thrown at the enemy to confusion in enemy soldiers and sometimes they decided to withdraw from battle.
TEXT.Polish: Garnki gliniane wypełnione rozdrażnionymi pszczołami, osami bądź szerzeniami.

TEXT.English: Abatis
TEXT.Polish: Zasieki

TEXT.English: Build an Abatis to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Abatis[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un'abbattuta per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Abatis to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Abatis, abattis, or abbattis is a term in field fortification for an obstacle formed (in the modern era) of the branches of trees laid in a row, with the sharpened tops directed outwards, towards the enemy. The trees are usually interlaced or tied with wire. Abatis are used alone or in combination with wire entanglements and other obstacles.
TEXT.Italian: Un'abbattuta è un tipo di fortificazione ottenuta intrecciando i rami degli alberi che vengono abbattuti in fila, con le chiome rivolte verso il nemico. Gli alberi sono solitamente incastrati o legati tra loro con dei fili, per aumentarne la reistenza; spesso, le abbattute vengono usate assieme a barriere di filo spinato e altri ostacoli.
TEXT.Polish: Zasieki, zasiek, zasiecz - pod taką nazwą znane były w wojskowości staropolskiej zapory z pni drzew w miejscach, których nie dało się ufortyfikować wałami ziemnymi. Robiono zasieki, czyli ścinano wiele drzew, które wraz z konarami i gałęziami tworzyły zaporę niedostępną dla konnicy. Zasieki stosowane były już w średniowieczu (zob. Przesieka Śląska) i to zarówno do zwalniania taborów nieprzyjaciela, jak i do blokowania ucieczki sił wroga w okrążeniu. Ostatni raz tego typu zasieki stosowali Kurpie w czasie potopu szwedzkiego.

TEXT.English: Fire Abatis
TEXT.French: Abatis de feu
TEXT.Polish: Ogniste Zasieki

TEXT.English: Build a Fire Abatis to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Abatis de feu[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un'abbattuta antincendio per migliorare le difese della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Fire Abatis to protect your city.

TEXT.English: An important weakness of abatis, in contrast to barbed wire, is that it can be destroyed by fire. Also, if laced together with rope instead of wire, the rope can be very quickly destroyed by such fires, after which the abatis can be quickly pulled apart by grappling hooks thrown from a safe distance.
TEXT.Italian: La debolezza principale delle abbattute, rispetto al filo spinato, è che possono essere distrutte dal fuoco; inoltre, se vengono tenute assime da corde invece che da fili metallici, queste corde possono essere disrtutte velocemente dagli incendi; dopodichè, le abbattute possono essere facilmente rimosse lanciando dei ganci da distanza di sicurezza.
TEXT.Polish: Zasieki - potocznie doraźna przeszkoda na przedpolu wykonywana w celu utrudnienia podejścia do linii obronnej, zwykle przeciwpiechotna. Te zasieki zostały dodatkowo podpalone.

TEXT.English: Spiked Pit Traps
TEXT.Polish: Zapadnia z kolcami

TEXT.English: Build a Spiked Pit Traps to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fosses piégées[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Spiked Pit Traps to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Trapping pits are deep pits dug into the ground, or built from stone, in order to trap animals. European rock drawings and cave paintings reveal that the elk and moose have been hunted since the stone age using trapping pits.
TEXT.Polish: Zapadnia - rodzaj pułapki w fortyfikacjach

TEXT.English: Germ Traps
TEXT.Polish: Biopułapki

TEXT.English: Build a Germ Traps to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pièges à microbes[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Pułapka wypełniona zabójczymi zarazkami i wirusami.

TEXT.English: Biological Warfare Traps.
TEXT.French: Pièges d'armes biologiques
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Germ Traps to protect your city.

TEXT.English: EMP Traps
TEXT.Polish: Pułapki EMP

TEXT.English: Build an EMP Traps to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pièges EMP[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Elektromagnetyczne Pułapki impulsowe

TEXT.English: Electromagnetic Pulse Traps.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Pułapki EMP, aby chronić miasto.

TEXT.English: Nanobot Traps
TEXT.Polish: NanoPułapki

TEXT.English: Build a Nanobot Traps to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pièges de Nanobots[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nanobot Traps to protect your city.

TEXT.English: Nanobotic Traps.
TEXT.French: Nanobotic Pulse Traps.
TEXT.German: Nanobotic Pulse Traps.
TEXT.Italian: Nanobotic Pulse Traps.
TEXT.Polish: Nanotechnologia - ogólna nazwa całego zestawu technik i sposobów tworzenia rozmaitych struktur o rozmiarach nanometrycznych, czyli na poziomie pojedynczych atomów i cząsteczek. Rozmiary nanometryczne nie są jednoznacznie zdefiniowane. Powszechnie znany przedział 1,5 - 100 nm nie znajduje potwierdzenia praktycznego. Obecnie uważa się iż granice rozmiarów nanometrycznych leżą tam, gdzie rozmiar struktury koreluje z właściwościami fizycznymi materiału.

TEXT.English: Gravity Traps
TEXT.Polish: Pułapki Grawitacyjne

TEXT.English: Build a Gravity Traps to protect your city.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pièges gravitationnels[COLOR_REVERT] pour protéger votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Pułapki Grawitacyjne

TEXT.English: Gravity Traps pin units to the floor or replell them into space.
TEXT.French: Pièges gravitationnels pin units to the floor or replell them into space.
TEXT.Polish: Pułapki raniące wrogów za pomocą grawitacyjnych "szpil".

TEXT.English: Carriage Builder
TEXT.German: Stellmacher
TEXT.Italian: Costruttore di carri
TEXT.Polish: Powozownia

TEXT.English: Factory (Automobiles)
TEXT.German: Fahrzeugfabrik
TEXT.Italian: Fabbrica di automobili
TEXT.Polish: Fabryka Samochodów

TEXT.English: Steamboat Port
TEXT.German: Dampfschiffhafen
TEXT.Italian: Porto per battelli a vapore
TEXT.Polish: Przystań Parostatków

TEXT.English: Railroad Station
TEXT.German: Eisenbahnstation
TEXT.Italian: Stazione ferroviaria
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Kolejowa

TEXT.English: Maglev Station
TEXT.German: Monorail-Station
TEXT.Italian: Stazione della monorotaia
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Koleji Jednoszynowej

TEXT.English: Grand Central Station
TEXT.German: Hauptbahnhof
TEXT.Italian: Grande stazione centrale

TEXT.English: Gas Station
TEXT.German: Tankstelle
TEXT.Italian: Benzinaio
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Paliw

TEXT.English: Ethanol Station
TEXT.German: Ethanol-Tankstelle
TEXT.Italian: Rifornitore di etanolo
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Ethanol S.A.

TEXT.English: Bus Station
TEXT.German: Busbahnhof
TEXT.Italian: Stazione dei bus
TEXT.Polish: Przystanek Autobusowy

TEXT.English: Skyroad Station
TEXT.German: Skyroad-Station
TEXT.Italian: Stazione delle rotte aeree
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Aerobusów

TEXT.English: Parking Meters
TEXT.German: Parkuhren
TEXT.Italian: Parchimetri
TEXT.Polish: Parkometry

TEXT.English: Build a Carriage Builder to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un costruttore di carri per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build an Automobile Factory to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una fabbrica di automobili per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Steamboat Port to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente la valeur des routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un porto per battelli a vapore per incrementare il commercio della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Railroad Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una stazione ferroviaria per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Monorail Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una stazione della monorotaia per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build Grand Central Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Grande stazione centrale per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.
TEXT.Spanish: Build Grand Central Stationincrease your cities wealth and production.

TEXT.English: Build a Gas Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un benzinaio per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build an Ethanol Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un rifonitore di etanolo per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Bus Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una stazione dei bus per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Skyroad Station to increase your cities wealth and production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse et la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una stazione delle rotte aeree per incrementare la ricchezza e la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Build a Parking Meter to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci dei parchimetri per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.

TEXT.English: A stagecoach is a type of four-wheeled closed coach for passengers and goods, strongly sprung and drawn by four horses, usually four-in-hand.
TEXT.Italian: Una carrozza è un mezzo a quattro ruote coperto utilizzato per il trasporto di merci e passeggeri; è solitamente mossa da quattro cavalli.
TEXT.Polish: Karoca (z wł. carrozza) to bardzo bogato zdobiony powóz kryty, rodzaj karety. Modny w okresie od XVI do XVIII wieku. Początkowo pudło zawieszone było na skórzanych pasach, później na resorach i posiadały przeszklone okienka. W Polsce pojawiły się za panowania króla Stefana Batorego.

TEXT.English: An automobile, motor car or car is a wheeled motor vehicle used for transporting passengers, which also carries its own engine or motor.
TEXT.Italian: Un'automobile è un veicolo a motore utilizzato per il trasporto di passeggeri, dotata di un motore proprio.
TEXT.Polish: Fabryka Samochodów

TEXT.English: The term steamboat is usually used to refer to smaller steam-powered boats working on lakes and rivers, particularly riverboats; steamship generally refers to larger steam-powered ships, usually ocean-going, capable of carrying a (ship's) boat.
TEXT.Italian: I battelli a vapore erano piccole navi a vapore usate per la navigazione fluviale e lacustre; solo le navi a vapore più grandi erano in grado di navigare anche sugli oceani.
TEXT.Polish: Parowiec - statek lub okręt o napędzie parowym, napędzany tłokowąmaszyną parową (SS) lub turbiną parową (TSS). Pierwszy parowiec wypłynął w rejs w 1807 roku. Początkowo parowce były dość niebezpieczne, gdyż często zdarzały się eksplozje niewystarczająco wytrzymałych kotłów. Udoskonalono je w drugiej połowie XIX wieku i wtedy rejsy parowcami stały się regularne.

TEXT.English: A railroad station is a railway facility where trains regularly stop to load or unload passengers or freight (goods). It generally consists of a platform next to the tracks and a building (depot) providing related services such as ticket sales and waiting rooms.
TEXT.Italian: Una stazione ferroviaria è un posto in cui il treno si ferma regolarmente per caricare e scaricare merci o passeggeri; solitamente è cosituita da una piattaforma vicino al treno e da edifici contenenti magazzini, biglietterie, sale d'attesa e altri servizi.
TEXT.Polish: Stacja kolejowa - posterunek ruchu następczy zapowiadawczy, w obrębie którego, oprócz toru głównego zasadniczego, znajduje się co najmniej jeden tor główny dodatkowy, a pociągi mogą rozpoczynać i kończyć swój bieg, krzyżować się i wyprzedzać, jak również zmieniać skład lub kierunek jazdy.

TEXT.English: A monorail is a rail-based transportation system based on a single rail, which acts as its sole support and its guideway. The term is also used variously to describe the beam of the system, or the vehicles traveling on such a beam or track.
TEXT.Italian: Una monorotaia è un sistema si trasporto basato su una rotaia singola, che funziona come guida e supporto. Il termine viene usato per indicare sia il tracciato, sia il veicolo che si muove sul tracciato stesso.
TEXT.Polish: Kolej jednoszynowa - kolej szynowa, w której pojazdy poruszają się po jednej szynie. Szyna jest najczęściej prowadzona ponad ziemią na specjalnej estakadzie. Estakada z reguły pełni również funkcję trzeciej szyny. Najpopularniejszym systemem jednoszynowym jest belka żelbetowao szerokości 60-90 cm, po której wagon przejeżdża okrakiem, utrzymując się dzięki kołom stykającym się zarówno z powierzchnią górną, jak i boczną szyny. Specyficzną odmianą kolei jednoszynowej jest kolej wisząca, używana głównie w transporcie wewnątrz zakładowym.

TEXT.English: Grand Central Station is a terminal station at 42nd Street and Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan in New York City. Built by and named for the New York Central Railroad in the heyday of American long-distance passenger trains, it is the largest train station in the world by number of platforms.
TEXT.French: une Station de Transport Centrale is a terminal station at 42nd Street and Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan in New York City. Built by and named for the New York Central Railroad in the heyday of American long-distance passenger trains, it is the largest train station in the world by number of platforms.
TEXT.Italian: Grand Central Station è una stazione situata all'incrocio tra 42nd Street e Park Avenue a Manhattan, in New York City. Costruita dalla New York Central Railroad agli albori dei viaggi su lunga distanza in America, è la più grande stazione al mondo per numero di binari.
TEXT.Polish: Grand Central Terminal (potocznie określany jako Grand Central Station) - dworzec kolei podmiejskich, położony przy 42nd Street i Park Avenue na obszarze Midtown Manhattan w Nowym Jorku w Stanach Zjednoczonych. Został wybudowany w czasach świetności amerykańskich pociągów dalekobieżnych (otwarty w 1871, po wyburzeniu starego budynku - nowy, obecny gmach GCT zainaugurował działalność 2 lutego 1913), a jego nazwa bezpośrednio nawiązywała do New York Central Railroad - istniejącej wówczas linii kolejowej operującej na terenie większości północno-wschodniej części Stanów Zjednoczonych i łączącej m.in. Nowy Jork, Boston, Chicago i Saint Louis. Grand Central Terminal stanowił najważniejszy składnik infrastruktury tej historycznej już linii kolejowej. Jest to największy dworzec kolejowy na świecie pod względem liczby peronów (44).

TEXT.English: A Gas Station is a facility which sells fuel and lubricants for motor vehicles. The most common fuels sold are petrol or diesel fuel.
TEXT.French: A une Station d'essence is a facility which sells fuel and lubricants for motor vehicles. The most common fuels sold are petrol or diesel fuel.
TEXT.Italian: Un benzinaio è un impianto in cui vengono venduti carburante e lubrificanti per i veicoli a motore; i carburanti più venduti sono benzina e diesel.
TEXT.Polish: Stacja benzynowa (stacja paliw) - punkt sprzedaży detalicznej paliw płynnych - głównie benzyn, także oleju napędowego oraz gazu płynnego (LPG), płynów chłodzących, środków czyszczących itp.

TEXT.English: Ethanol fuel is ethanol (ethyl alcohol), the same type of alcohol found in alcoholic beverages. It can be used as a transport fuel, mainly as a biofuel additive for gasoline.
TEXT.Italian: L'etanolo usato come carburante è lo stesso etanolo che si trova nelle bevande alcoliche; può essere usato come carburante, in particolare come additivo di origine biologica per la benzina.
TEXT.Polish: Stacja benzynowa (stacja paliw) - punkt sprzedaży detalicznej paliw płynnych - głównie benzyn, także oleju napędowego oraz gazu płynnego (LPG), płynów chłodzących, środków czyszczących itp.

TEXT.English: A bus station is a structure where city or intercity buses stop to pick up and drop off passengers.
TEXT.Italian: Una stazione dei bus è una struttura dove i bus si fermano per far salire o scendere i passeggeri.
TEXT.Polish: Przystanek autobusowy - miejsce, w którym zgodnie z określoną trasą usługi regularnej planowany jest przystanek służący wejściu na pokład autobusu lub jego opuszczeniu przez pasażerów.

TEXT.English: A hovercar is a transport vehicle used for personal transportation in the same way a modern automobile is employed. You must steer it, like you would a normal vehicle. The only difference is the "flying" effect.
TEXT.Italian: Una hovercar è un mezzo di trasporto usato in modo simile alle normali automobili; deve essere guidata come un normale veicolo, l'unica differenza è che una hovercar vola.

TEXT.English: A parking meter is a device used to collect money in exchange for the right to park a vehicle in a particular place for a limited amount of time.
TEXT.Italian: Un parchimetro è uno strumento usato utilizzato per raccogliere sooldi in cambio del dirittto di parcheggiare un veicolo in un determinato posto per un periodo limitato di tempo.
TEXT.Polish: Parkometr - urządzenie, które po wrzuceniu odpowiednich monet odmierza czas postoju bezpośrednio obok tego urządzenia zaparkowanego pojazdu.

TEXT.English: Caravan Post
TEXT.German: Karawanserai
TEXT.Italian: Caravanserraglio
TEXT.Polish: Postój Karawan

TEXT.English: Increases trade route yield. This building requires Barter civic.
TEXT.French: Augmente le Rendement des routes commerciales. Nécessite la Doctrine 'Troc'.
TEXT.Italian: Migliora la resa delle rotte commerciali. Quest'edificio richiede la forma di governo "Baratto".
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa handel. Wymaga doktryny wymiana.

TEXT.English: A caravan is a group of people traveling together, often on a trade expedition. Caravans were used mainly in desert areas and throughout the Silk Road, where traveling in groups aided in defense against bandits as well as helped to improve economies of scale in trade. Trading posts are common along caravan routes, which sell supplies to merchants and take the opportunity to stock up on whatever exotic goods the caravan in transporting.
TEXT.Italian: Una carovana è un gruppo di persone che viaggiano assieme, solitamente per una spedizione commerciale. Le carovane venivano utilizzate principalmente nelle zone desertiche e lungo tutta la Via della Seta, dove viaggiare in gruppi aiutava nella difesa contro i banditi, così come contribuiva a migliorare le economie di scala nel commercio. Le stazioni commerciali erano comuni lungo le rotte carovaniere, dove venivano vendute forniture ai commercianti che coglievano l'occasione per fare scorta di qualunque merce esotica la carovana potesse trasportare.
TEXT.Polish: Karawanseraj, chan, chana (pers. zajazd dla karawan) - dom zajezdny dlakarawan lub miejsce postoju karawany z pomieszczeniami dla podróżnych,niszami chroniącymi przed słońcem, magazynem dla przechowania towarów, często o charakterze obronnym, budowany w krajach arabskich, Persji i Azji Środkowej.

TEXT.English: Bicycle Shop
TEXT.Italian: Negozio di biciclette
TEXT.Polish: Sklep Rowerowy

TEXT.English: Build a Bicycle Shop to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un negozio d biciclette per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Bicycle Shop by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A local bike shop or local bicycle shop is a small business specializing in bicycle sale, maintenance and parts.
TEXT.Italian: Un negozio di biciclette è solitamente un piccolo edificio specializzato nella vendita, manutenzione e riparazione delle biciclette.
TEXT.Polish: Rower - jedno- lub wielośladowy pojazd drogowynapędzany siłą mięśni poruszających się nim osób za pomocą przekładni mechanicznej, wprawianej w ruch (najczęściej) nogami.

TEXT.English: Trails
TEXT.Italian: Sentieri
TEXT.Polish: Ścieżki

TEXT.English: Build Trails to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente le taux de vos routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci i sentieri per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Trails by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A trail is a path with a rough beaten or dirt/stone surface used for travel. Trails may be for use only by walkers and in some places are the main access route to remote settlements.
TEXT.French: A trail is a path with a rough beaten or dirt/stone surface used for travel. un Chemins et pistes may be for use only by walkers and in some places are the main access route to remote settlements.
TEXT.Italian: Un sentiero è un tracciato in pietra o terra battuta, utilizzato per gli spostamenti. I sentieri possono essere usati solo da persone a piedi, ed in alcuni casi sono l'unica via d'accesso ad alcuni insediamenti isolati.
TEXT.Polish: Ścieżki to pierwszy rodzaj szlaku jaki jest wytyczany przez wspólnoty ludzkie, zwykle wąskie i niewygodne.

TEXT.English: Roads
TEXT.Italian: Strade
TEXT.Polish: Drogi

TEXT.English: Build Roads to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente le taux de vos routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le strade per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Roads by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A road is a thoroughfare, route, or way on land between two places, which typically has been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by some conveyance, including a horse, cart, or motor vehicle.
TEXT.Italian: Una strada è un percorso tra due posti il cui fondo viene pavimentato o livellato in altro modo, in modo da consentire il passaggio a persone, animali e veicoli.
TEXT.Polish: Droga kołowa jest to droga przeznaczona do poruszania się za pomocą pojazdów kołowych. Droga taka zazwyczaj charakteryzuje się utwardzoną nawierzchnią (zwykle asfalt, beton, żwir, szuter, bruk itp.). Utwardzenie składa się zazwyczaj z kilku warstw, ale może nim być również tylko utwardzenie powierzchni gruntu.

TEXT.English: Asphalt Roads
TEXT.Italian: Strade asfaltate
TEXT.Polish: Asfaltowe Drogi

TEXT.English: Build Asphalt Roads to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente le taux de vos routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le strade asfaltate per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Asphalt Roads by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Asphalt is the sticky, black and highly viscous liquid or semi-solid present in most crude petroleums and in some natural deposits; it is a substance classed as a pitch. Until the 20th century, the term asphaltum was also used.
TEXT.Italian: L'asfalto è una sostanza nera e altamente viscosa, liquida o semi-solida, presente nel petrolio greggio e in alcuni depositi naturali; è una sostanza classificata come catrame.
TEXT.Polish: Potocznie asfaltem nazywa się asfaltobeton, czyli mieszankę mineralno-asfaltową używaną do budowy nawierzchni dróg, w której asfalt używany jest jako lepiszcze wiążące kruszywa. Masa ta w polszczyźnie okresu międzywojennego nosiła nazwę smołowiec. Asfaltu nie należy mylić ze smołą, która jest produktem odgazowania węgla bądź drewna, a nie frakcją ropy naftowej.

TEXT.English: Skyroad Control Tower
TEXT.French: Tour de Contrôle pour Routes aériennes
TEXT.Italian: Torre di controllo delle rotte aeree
TEXT.Polish: Wieża Kontroli Aerobusów

TEXT.English: Build Skyroad Control Tower to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente le taux de vos routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una torre di controlle delle rotte aeree per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Skyroad Control Tower by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A flying car or roadable aircraft is an aircraft that can also travel along roads. All the working examples have required some manual or automated process of conversion between the two modes of operation.
TEXT.Italian: Una macchina volante è un velivolo in grado di viaggiare anche lungo le normali strade. Tutti i prototipi attuali richiedono un processo di conersione, automatizzata o manuale, per passare dalla configurazione di veicolo a quella di velivolo, e viceversa.

TEXT.English: Teleport Booth
TEXT.Italian: Cabina per il teletrasporto
TEXT.Polish: Budka Teleportacji

TEXT.English: Build Teleport Booth to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Augmente le taux de vos routes commerciales.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una cabina per il teletrasporto per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Teleport Booth by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Teleportation is a term that refers to a number of theories and notions concerning the transfer of matter from one point to another without traversing the physical space between them, similar to the concept apport, an earlier word used in the context of spiritualism.
TEXT.Italian: Il teletrasporto è una teoria scientifica che sostiene sia possibile spostare la materia da un punto ad un altro, senza attraversare la materia fisica fra questi due punti.
TEXT.Polish: Teleportacja jest bardzo popularnym motywem fantastyki naukowej, gdzie występują urządzenia jak międzygwiezdne teleportery, zwłaszcza tak zwanej hard science-fiction. Występowała między innymi w twórczości Stanisława Lema (np. w utworze "Człowiek z Marsa"), Harry'ego Harrisona (w utworze Krok od Ziemi) oraz w serii Star Trek.

TEXT.English: Traffic Signals
TEXT.Italian: Semafori
TEXT.Polish: Sygnalizacja Świetlna

TEXT.English: Build Traffic Signals to increase your cities production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la fluidité du trafic, et votre production.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci dei semafori per incrementare la produzione della tua città.

TEXT.English: Traffic signals are signalling devices positioned at road intersections, pedestrian crossings and other locations to control competing flows of traffic.
TEXT.Italian: I semafori sono dispositivi posizionati agli incroci delle strade e sugli attraversamenti pedonali; servono a controllare il flusso del traffico.

TEXT.English: Road Signs
TEXT.Italian: Segnali stradali
TEXT.Polish: Znaki Drogowe

TEXT.English: Build Road Signs to increase your cities production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci i segnali stradali per incrementare la produzione della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Road Signs by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Road signs are signs erected at the side of roads to provide information to road users. With traffic volumes increasing over the last eight decades, many countries have adopted pictorial signs or otherwise simplified and standardized their signs to facilitate international travel where language differences would create barriers, and in general to help enhance traffic safety.
TEXT.Italian: I segnali stradali sono segnali posizionati ai lati delle strade pr fornire informazioni agli utenti della strada. Dato che il traffico è decisamente aumentato negli ultimi ottant'anni, molti paesi hanno adottato vari segnali semplificati e standardizzati, per facilitare il traffico anche agli stranieri nel caso che le differenze di lingua fossero un ostacolo, ed in generale per migliorare la sicurezza del traffico.
TEXT.Polish: Znak drogowy - znak obowiązujący w ruchu drogowym, którego znaczenie i zakres obowiązywania określone jest w przepisach prawa - na terytorium Polski znaki drogowe normowane są zapisami rozporządzenia w sprawie znaków i sygnałów drogowych.

TEXT.English: Street Cars
TEXT.Italian: Tram
TEXT.Polish: Współczesne Tramwaje

TEXT.English: Build Street Cars to increase your cities production and wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente richesse et production dans votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci i tram per incrementare la produzione e la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Street Cars to increase your cities production and wealth.

TEXT.English: A Street Car is a passenger rail vehicle which runs on tracks along public urban streets and also sometimes on separate rights of way.
TEXT.Italian: Untram è un veicolo per passeggeri che corre su rotaia su tracciati disposti lungo le vie pubbliche, e a volte su corsie separate.
TEXT.Polish: Obecnie tramwaje napędzane są (z nielicznymi wyjątkami) wyłącznie silnikami elektrycznymi. Prąd dostarczany jest zsieci trakcyjnej, a niekiedy także z trzeciej szyny lub akumulatorów. Dawniej używano również tramwajów konnych, parowych lub spalinowych, jak również systemów z napędem stacjonarnym (San Francisco), wagonów akumulatorowych lub napędzanych silnikami pneumatycznymi.

TEXT.English: Cable Cars
TEXT.Italian: Funivia
TEXT.Polish: Tramwaje

TEXT.English: Build Cable Cars to increase your cities production and wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente richesse et production dans votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una funivia per incrementare la produzione e la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cable Cars to increase your cities production and wealth.

TEXT.English: A cable car is any of a variety of transportation systems relying on cables to pull vehicles along or lower them at a steady rate, or a vehicle on these systems.
TEXT.Italian: Una funivia è un dispositivo di cavi e argani che permette di trainare una cabina, spostandola ad altezze differenti.
TEXT.Polish: Tramwaj (z ang. tramway - linia tramwajowa, tram - tramwaj) - pasażerski pojazd drogowy o miejscach siedzących dla więcej niż dziewięciu osób (łącznie z motorniczym), podłączony do przewodów elektrycznych lub napędzany silnikiem spalinowym oraz poruszający się po szynach. Według innej definicji tramwaje to pasażerskie lub towarowe pojazdy szynowe zaprojektowane do eksploatacji na liniach tramwajowych.

TEXT.English: Subway Station
TEXT.Italian: Stazione della metropolitana
TEXT.Polish: Stacja Metra

TEXT.English: Build Subway Station to increase your cities production and wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente richesse et production dans votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una stazione della metropolitana per incrementare la produzione e la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Subway Station to increase your cities production and wealth.

TEXT.English: A subway station is a railway station for a rapid transit system. It is often underground or elevated. At crossings of metro lines, they are multi-level.
TEXT.Italian: Una stazione della metropolitana è un punto di fermata della metro; spesso è situata sottoterra, oppure in edifici rialzati dal terreno. All'incrocio di diverse linee della metro, queste stazioni si sviluppano su diversi livelli.
TEXT.Polish: Stacja metra - wyznaczony obszar na linii metra, na którym zatrzymują się pociągi. Stacje metra najczęściej budowane są na obszarach wysoko zurbanizowanych, co ma na celu obsłużenie jak największej liczby pasażerów. Przystanki położone pod ziemią muszą być wyposażone w niezbędny system wentylacyjny oraz posiadać dodatkowe wyjścia ewakuacyjne. Wiele stacji metra pełni rolę schronów przeciwlotniczych w czasie wojny.

TEXT.English: Gondola Canals
TEXT.Italian: Canali per gondole
TEXT.Polish: Kanały Gondolierskie

TEXT.English: Build Gondola Canals to increase your cities production and wealth.
TEXT.French: Augmente richesse et production dans votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci canali per le gondole per incrementare la produzione e la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Gondola Canals to increase your cities production and wealth.

TEXT.English: The gondola is a traditional, flat-bottomed Venetian rowing boat, well suited to the conditions of the Venetian lagoon. For centuries gondolas were the chief means of transportation and most common watercraft within Venice.
TEXT.Italian: La gondola è la barca tradizionale di Venezia: dotata di un fondo piatto, è perfetta per le condizioni della laguna veneta. Per secoli le gondole sono state il principale mezzo di trasporto e l'imbarcazione più comune di tutta Venezia.
TEXT.Polish: Gondola - łódź wiosłowa, napędzana i kierowana przez wioślarza zwanego gondolierem, służąca tradycyjnie do przemieszczania się po kanałach miasta Wenecji, obecnie raczej w charakterze atrakcji turystycznej.

TEXT.English: National Aircraft Museum
TEXT.French: Musée National de l'Aviation
TEXT.Italian: Museo Nazionale dell'Aviazione
TEXT.Polish: Narodowe Muzeum Lotnictwa

TEXT.English: Build a National Aircraft Museum to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Musée National de l'Aviation[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Museo Nazionale dell'aviazione per incrementare la ricerca della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Aircraft Museum by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A Museum for Aircraft.
TEXT.Italian: Un museo che contiene aerei di diverse epoche.
TEXT.Polish: Muzeum Lotnictwa Polskiego - muzeum w Krakowie zlokalizowane na terenach dawnego lotniska Rakowice-Czyżyny, gromadzące eksponaty związane z historią rozwoju lotnictwa. Liczba eksponowanych obecniestatków powietrznych przekracza 200. Muzeum wydaje własne publikacje, organizuje imprezy o charakterze edukacyjnym. Jest też uczestnikiem i organizatorem konferencji poświęconych historii lotnictwa i muzealnictwu. Posiada również bibliotekę z ponad 30 tysiącami pozycji. Znalazło się na ósmym miejscu listy najlepszych muzeów lotnictwa na świecie telewizjiCNN.

TEXT.English: Flight School
TEXT.French: Ecole de pilotage
TEXT.Italian: Scuola di volo
TEXT.Polish: Szkoła Latania

TEXT.English: Build a Flight School to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ecole de pilotage[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una scuola di volo per incrementare la ricerca della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Flight School by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Flight training is a course of study used when learning to pilot an aircraft. The overall purpose of primary and intermediate flight training is the acquisition and honing of basic airmanship skills.
TEXT.Italian: L'istruzione al volo è un corso in cui i piloti imparano a guidare un aeroplano. Lo scopo principale dell'addestramento base al volo consiste nell'acquisizione delle principali tecniche di controllo dei velivoli.
TEXT.Polish: Szkoła Latania to rodzaj szkoły w której piloci są uczeni swojego fachu.

TEXT.English: National Railroad Museum
TEXT.French: Musée National du Chemin de Fer
TEXT.Italian: Museo Nazionale delle Ferrovie
TEXT.Polish: Muzeum Kolejnictwa

TEXT.English: Build a National Railroad Museum to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Musée National du Chemin de Fer[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Museo Nazionale delle Ferrovie per incrementare la ricerca della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Railroad Museum by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A Museum for Trains.
TEXT.Italian: Un museo per i treni e le ferrovie in generale.
TEXT.Polish: Muzeum w którym wystawione są historyczne wagony kolejowe oraz parowozy.

TEXT.English: Intelligent Pavement
TEXT.French: Trottoirs Intelligents
TEXT.Italian: Pavimentazioni intelligenti
TEXT.Polish: Inteligentny Chodnik

TEXT.English: Build an Intelligent Pavement to increase your cities efficiency.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trottoirs Intelligents[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'efficacité de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci le pavimentazioni intelligenti per incrementare l'efficienza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Intelligent Pavement to increase your cities efficiency.

TEXT.English: The Intelligent Street is the name given to a type of intelligent environment which can be found on public transit street*. It has arisen from the convergence of communications and Ubiquitous Computing, intelligent and adaptable user interfaces, and the common infrastructure of the intelligent or mixed pavement.
TEXT.Italian: Le pavimentazioni intelligenti sono speciali sostanze intelligenti che possono essere trovate sulle strade aperte al traffico. Derivano dalla convergenza di comunicazioni, di interfacce utenti adattabili e intelligenti, e delle comuni infrastrutture delle pavimentazioni.

TEXT.English: Highway
TEXT.French: Autoroutes
TEXT.Italian: Autostrade
TEXT.Polish: Autostrada

TEXT.English: Build a Highway to increase your cities traffic.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Autoroutes[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer la fluidité du trafic de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un'autostrada to increase your cities traffic.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Highway to increase your cities traffic.

TEXT.English: A highway is any public road or other public way on land; the term exists in distinction to waterway. In North American and Australian English, the term frequently implies major roads under the control of a state or provincial agency instead of a local road authority. In British English, highway is primarily a legal term, and normal usage implies roads, while legal usage covers any route or path with a public right of access, including footpaths etc. The term has led to several related derived terms, including highway system, highway code, and highway patrol.
TEXT.Italian: Un'autostrada è una via di trasporto pubblico progettata esclusivamente per i veicoli a motore; sono quindi esclusi i veicoli trainati da animali, le biciclette, gli uomini a piedi e qualsiasi veicolo che non rispetti i requisiti minimi di cilindrata, dimensioni o altri parametri.
TEXT.Polish: Autostrada - droga o ograniczonej dostępności, zaprojektowana i zbudowana w celu zapewnienia bezpiecznego, szybkiego, płynnego ruchu pojazdów.

TEXT.English: Driving School
TEXT.French: Auto-Ecole
TEXT.Italian: Scuola di guida
TEXT.Polish: Szkoła Jazdy

TEXT.English: Build a Driving School to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Auto-Ecole[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una scuola di guida per incrementare la ricerca della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Driving School by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Driver's education or driver's ed is a formal class or program that prepares a new driver to obtain a learner's permit or driver's license. It may take place in a classroom, in a vehicle, online, or a combination of the above. Topics of instruction include traffic code or laws and vehicle operation. Typically, instruction will warn of dangerous conditions in driving such as road conditions, driver impairments, and hazardous weather. Instructional videos may also be shown, demonstrating proper driving strategies and the consequences for not observing the rules. The term driver's ed is one that is typically used in the United States, and other countries often have other terms for a driving test or examination.
TEXT.Italian: Le scuole guida permettono alle persone di ottenere una patente di guida. Le lezioni si svolgono in una classe, su un veicolo, online, oppure in una combinazione di questi luoghi. Le materie di studio includono il codice stradale e alcune nozioni base sul funzionamento dei veicoli. Solitamente, vengono evidenziati i rischi delle situazioni pericolose nella guida, come le condizioni della strada, gli errori dei guidatori e le condizioni meteo avverse. Può anche succedere che vengano mostrati dei video, per presentare vari metodi di guida e per mostrare le conseguenze dell'inosservanza delle regole.
TEXT.Polish: Zadania ośrodka związane są z szeroko pojętym bezpieczeństwem ruchu drogowego. Dotyczą przede wszystkim przeprowadzania egzaminu państwowego dla kandydatów ubiegających się oprawo jazdy.

TEXT.English: Helicopter Training Center
TEXT.French: Centre de pilotage d'Hélicoptère
TEXT.Italian: Scuola per piloti di elicottero
TEXT.Polish: Centrum Szkolenia Pilotów Helikopterów

TEXT.English: Build a Helicopter Training Center to increase your cities military.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de pilotage d'Hélicoptère[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production militaire de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una scuole per piloti di elicottero per incrementare la produzione militare della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Helicopter Training Center to increase your cities military.

TEXT.English: A helicopter is a type of rotorcraft in which lift and thrust are supplied by engine-driven rotors. This allows the helicopter to take off and land vertically, to hover, and to fly forwards, backwards, and laterally. These attributes allow helicopters to be used in congested or isolated areas where fixed-wing aircraft would usually not be able to take off or land. The capability to efficiently hover for extended periods of time allows a helicopter to accomplish tasks that fixed-wing aircraft and other forms of vertical takeoff and landing aircraft cannot perform.
TEXT.Italian: Un elicottero è un velivolo in cui la spinta viene fornita dai rotori, che vengono mossi da un motore. Questo permette all'elicottero di decollare e atterrare verticalmetne, di rimanere fermo in aria, di spostarsi lateralmente, avanti e perfino indietro. Queste caratteristiche permettono all'elicottero di essere usato in aree congestionate o molto isolate, in cui i veicoli ad ala fissa non sarebbero in grado di atterrare o decollare. La capacità di rimanre in aria per estesi periodi di tempo permette agli elicotteri di svolgere compiti che gli aerei ad ala fissa non possono svolgere.
TEXT.Polish: W toku studiów słuchacze zapoznawali się z zasadami walki lotniczej i sprzętem bojowym oraz zasadami współdziałania lotnictwa z wojskami lądowymi na polu walki. Główne szkolenie zawierało zaznajomienie słuchaczy z zasadami dowodzenia na szczeblu operacyjnym i na użyciu w walce większych jednostek lotniczych. Zapoznawano też z zasadami obrony plot i rolą w niej lotnictwa. Słuchacze studiowali taktykę ogólną i rodzajów wojsk oraz operacyjną służbę sztabów, armie obce, historie i geografię wojenną. Prowadzono gry wojenne i manewry międzydywizyjne oraz podróże terenowo-krajoznawcze.

TEXT.English: Jet Propulsion Laboratory
TEXT.French: Laboratoire de Test de Propulsion
TEXT.Italian: Laboratorio per la propulsione a getto
TEXT.Polish: Laboratorium Napędu Odrzutowego

TEXT.English: Build a Jet Propulsion Laboratory to increase your cities military.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de Test de Propulsion[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production militaire de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un laboratorio per la propulsione a getto per incrementare la produzione militare della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Jet Propulsion Laboratory to increase your cities military.

TEXT.English: Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is a federally funded research and development center and NASA field center located in Pasadena, California. JPL is managed by the nearby California Institute of Technology (Caltech) for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. The Laboratory's primary function is the construction and operation of robotic planetary spacecraft, though it also conducts Earth-orbit and astronomy missions. It is also responsible for operating NASA's Deep Space Network.
TEXT.French: Laboratoire de Test de Propulsion (JPL) is a federally funded research and development center and NASA field center located in Pasadena, California. JPL is managed by the nearby California Institute of Technology (Caltech) for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. The Laboratory's primary function is the construction and operation of robotic planetary spacecraft, though it also conducts Earth-orbit and astronomy missions. It is also responsible for operating NASA's Deep Space Network.
TEXT.Italian: Il Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) è un centro di ricerca federale controllato dalla NASA, situato a Pasadena in California. Il JPL è gestito dal California Institute of Technology (Caltech) per nome della National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). La funzione primaria del laboratorio è la costruzione di sonde robotiche usate per l'esplorazione planetaria di altri pianeti, anche se prepara anche missioni nell'orbita terrestre. Gestisce anche il Deep Space Network della NASA.
TEXT.Polish: Silnik odrzutowy - silnik spalinowy w którym pochodząca ze spalania paliwa energia cieplna jest przekształcana w energię kinetyczną gazów wypływających przez dyszę. Wyrzucane z dużą prędkością gazybędące produktem spalania tworzą siłę ciągu w przeciwną stronę. Silnik odrzutowy utożsamiany jest często z silnikiem turboodrzutowym,dwuprzepływowym lub turbowentylatorowym. Do silników odrzutowych zalicza się też silnik rakietowy, silnik strumieniowy i silnik pulsacyjny. W silniku odrzutowym traktowanym jako silnik cieplny realizowany jest obieg Braytona-Joule'a.

TEXT.English: Test Pilot Institute
TEXT.French: Institut de Pilotes d'essai
TEXT.Italian: Istituto per piloti da collaudo
TEXT.Polish: Lotniczy Instytut Doświadczalny

TEXT.English: Build a Test Pilot Institute to increase your cities military.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Institut de Pilotes d'essai[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production militaire de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un istituto per piloti da collaudo per incrementare la produzione militare della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Test Pilot Institute to increase your cities military.

TEXT.English: A test pilot is an aviator who flies new and modified aircraft in specific maneuvers, known as flight test techniques or FTTs, allowing the results to be measured and the design to be evaluated.
TEXT.Italian: Un pilota collaudatore è un pilota che manovra aerei nuovi o modificati per compiere manovre specifiche, note come tecniche di volo di collaudo; queste permettono di misurare gli effetti delle manovre sull'aereo, per migliorare le caratteristiche dell'aereo stesso.
TEXT.Polish: Miejsce w którym testowane są nowe samoloty i inne rozwiązania lotnicze (silniki, awionika, aerodynamika skrzydeł itd)

TEXT.English: Parking Lot
TEXT.Italian: Parcheggio
TEXT.Polish: Parking Piętrowy

TEXT.English: Build a Parking Lot to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Places de Parking[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un parcheggio per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Parking Lot by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A parking lot is a cleared area that is intended for parking vehicles. Usually, the term refers to a dedicated area that has been provided with a durable or semi-durable surface.
TEXT.Italian: Un parcheggio è un'area aperta destinata alla sosta dei veicoli; solitamente, il termine si riferisce ad un'area attrezzata fornita di una pavimentazione permanente.
TEXT.Polish: Miejsca postojowe na parkingu są dostosowane do rozmiaru i charakteru pojazdów, z uwzględnieniem sposobu parkowania. W przypadku samochodu osobowego pojedynczestanowisko postojowe na parkingu umieszczone prostopadle do jezdni ma wedle polskich przepisów budowlanych wymiary minimalne 230 na 500 cm, zaś przylegająca jezdnia ma 600 cm szerokości. W innych krajach spotyka się zarówno mniejsze, jak i większe miejsca postojowe.

TEXT.English: Parking Garage
TEXT.French: Parking couvert
TEXT.Italian: Parcheggio coperto
TEXT.Polish: Parking

TEXT.English: Build a Parking Lot to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parking couvert[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un parcheggio coperto per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Parking Lot by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A parking garage is a building designed for car parking and where there are a number of floors or levels on which parking takes place. It is essentially a stacked car park.
TEXT.Italian: Un parcheggio coperto è un edificio destinato alla sosta dei veicoli, in cui le macchine vengono parcheggiate su vari livelli.
TEXT.Polish: Parking - wyznaczone miejsce służące do odstawiania (parkowania) pojazdów mechanicznychlub innych środków komunikacji.

TEXT.English: Drive-In Movie Theater
TEXT.French: Cinéma Drive-In
TEXT.Italian: Cinema drive-in
TEXT.Polish: Kino Samochodowe

TEXT.English: Build a Drive-In Movie Theater to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cinéma Drive-In[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un cinema drive-in per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Drive-In Movie Theater by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A drive-in theater is a form of cinema structure consisting of a large outdoor movie screen, a projection booth, a concession stand and a large parking area for automobiles. Within this enclosed area, customers can view movies from the privacy and comfort of their cars.
TEXT.Italian: Un cinema drive-in è costituito da un grande schermo situato di fronte ad un grande parcheggio per le automobili; i clienti possono quindi guardare il film comodamente dalle proprie automobili.
TEXT.Polish: Kino samochodowe (drive-in) - miejsce stanowiące połączenie kina zparkingiem, przeznaczone do oglądania filmów bezpośrednio z samochodów. Pomysł ten opatentował Richard Hollingshead w 1933 roku.

TEXT.English: Auto Repair Shop
TEXT.French: Garage Automobile
TEXT.Italian: Autofficina
TEXT.Polish: Warsztat naprawy samochodów.

TEXT.English: Build an Auto Repair Shop to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Garage Automobile[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un'autofficina per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]J.S. Bach's Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] increases happiness in all continental cities.

TEXT.English: An automobile repair shop (also known as a garage) is a repair shop where automobiles are repaired by auto mechanics and electricians.
TEXT.Italian: Un'autofficina è un edificio in cui le automobili vengono riparate da parte di meccanici ed elettricisti.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Auto Repair Shop by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Car Wash
TEXT.French: Centre de lavage auto
TEXT.Italian: Autolavaggio
TEXT.Polish: Myjnia Samochodowa

TEXT.English: Build a Car Wash to increase your cities wealth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de lavage auto[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un autolavaggio per incrementare la ricchezza della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Car Wash by zwiększyć bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A car wash is a facility used to clean the exterior and, in some cases, the interior of motor vehicles.
TEXT.Italian: Un autolavaggio è un impianto utilizzato per lavare l'esterno, e a volte anche l'interno, dei veicoli a motore.
TEXT.Polish: Myjnia samochodowa - miejsce oferujące usługę mycia samochodu. Aktualnie usługi myjni samochodowej to nie tylko mycie nadwozia i podwozia, ale również mycie silnika, woskowanie, odkurzanie, pranie tapicerki i inne.

TEXT.English: Rope Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont de cordes
TEXT.Italian: Ponte di corde
TEXT.Polish: Most Liniowy

TEXT.English: Build a Rope Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont de cordes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte di corde per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Rope Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A rope bridge is a bridge constructed chiefly of rope. In its simplest form, it can be one or two ropes that bridge a river, enabling the traveller to be supported in their crossing and not be swept away. One rope above another, for feet and hands, may be referred to as a commando bridge.
TEXT.Italian: Un ponte di corce è un ponte costruito principalmente in corde; nella sua forma più semplice, consiste in una o due corde che attraversano un fiume, permettendo ad un viaggiatore di attraversare senza essere portato via.
TEXT.Polish: Obiekt liniowy - rodzaj obiektu budowlanego, którego charakterystycznym parametrem jest długość. Pojęcie obiektu budowlanego zostało zdefiniowane w Prawie budowlanym. Wyodrębnienie tej grupy obiektów budowlanych jako odrębnego pojęcia zostało dokonane celem sprecyzowania pewnych specyficznych zapisów w przepisach prawa dotyczących tylko tej grupy, np. w kwestii pewnych procedur prawno-administracynych[a], braku obowiązku umieszczenia tablicy informacyjnej[b], itp.. Zaliczenie obiektu liniowego do grupy obiektów budowlanych dokonane jest w art. 3 pkt 3 Prawa budowlanego[c], a jego definicja znajduje się w art. 3 pkt 3a tej ustawy. Definicja ta oprócz zwartego wyżej określenia, że jest to obiekt, którego charakterystycznym parametrem jest długość, zawiera także wyliczenie podstawowych obiektów liniowych.

TEXT.English: Log Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont en troncs d'arbres
TEXT.Italian: Ponte in tronchi d'albero
TEXT.Polish: Most z kłód

TEXT.English: Build a Log Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont en troncs d'arbres[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte in tronchi d'albero per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Log Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A log bridge is a bridge that uses logs that fall naturally or are intentionally felled or placed across streams. The first manmade bridges with significant span were probably intentionally felled trees. The use of emplaced logs is now sometimes used in temporary bridges used for logging roads, where a forest tract is to be harvested and the road then abandoned. Such log bridges have a severely limited lifetime due to soil contact and subsequent rot and wood-eating insect infestation. Longer lasting log bridges may be constructed by using treated logs and/or by providing well drained footings of stone or concrete combined with regular maintenance to prevent soil infiltration. This care in construction can be seen in the bridge illustrated, which has well locked dry set stone abutments and a footpath leveled with boards.
TEXT.Italian: Un ponte in tronchi d'albero è un ponte che utilizza alberi caduti per cause naturali, oppure tagliati appositamente, per attraversare i corsi d'acqua. I primi ponti costruiti dall'uomo di una certa dimensione erano probabilmente dei tronchi tagliati intenzionalmente. Al giorno d'oggi, i ponti in tronchi d'albero vengono usati nei ponti temporanei, creati ad esempio quando viene tagliato un bosco e la relativa strada d'accesso. Questi ponti hanno una vita decisamente limitata a causa del contatto diretto con il suolo, che fa marcire il legno. Ponti che durano più a lungo possono essere costruiti usando legni trattati o costruendo fondamenta in pietra o cemento, in modo che il drenaggio e una manutenzione più regolare riducano il degrado del legno. Questo tipo di costruzione può essere visto nel ponte disegnto in figura, con piloni in pietra e superficie calpestabile fatta di tronchi.
TEXT.Polish: Kłoda - drewno okrągłe wielko- i średniowymiarowe o długości od 2,7 do 6,0 m (według PN - 93 D - 02002 - Podział, terminologia i symbole).

TEXT.English: Bamboo Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont en Bambou
TEXT.Italian: Ponte di bambù
TEXT.Polish: Bambusowy Most

TEXT.English: Build a Bamboo Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont en Bambou[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte di bambù per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Bamboo Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A bridge made of bamboo.
TEXT.Italian: Un ponte fatto di bambù.
TEXT.Polish: Most z powiązanych ze sobą bambusowych kłód.

TEXT.English: Stone Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont de pierres
TEXT.Italian: Ponte in pietra
TEXT.Polish: Kamienny Most

TEXT.English: Build a Stone Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont de pierres[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte in pietra per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Stone Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: The Arkadiko Bridge is one of four Mycenaean corbel arch bridges part of a former network of roads, designed to accommodate chariots, between Tiryns to Epidauros in the Peloponnese, in Greece. Dating to the Greek Bronze Age (13th century BC), it is one of the oldest arch bridges still in existence and use. Several intact arched stone bridges from the Hellenistic era can be found in the Peloponnese in southern Greece.
TEXT.Italian: Il ponte Arkadiko è uno di quattro ponti ad arco in pietra Micenei che erano parte di una rete stradale, progettata per i carri, tra Tirinto e Epidauro, nel Peloponneso (Grecia). Risalente all'età del bronzo greca (13° secolo a.C.), è uno dei più antichi ponti che vien ancora utilizzato. Molti ponti ad arco in pietra risalenti al periodo Ellenistico sono ancora intatti nel Peloponneso.
TEXT.Polish: Most zbudowany z kamiennych głazów.

TEXT.English: Brick Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont en briques
TEXT.Italian: Ponte in mattoni
TEXT.Polish: Most Ceglany

TEXT.English: Build a Brick Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont en briques[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte in mattoni per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Brick Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A bridge made of bricks.
TEXT.Italian: Un ponte fatto di mattoni.
TEXT.Polish: Most zbudowany z cegieł wypalanych na słońcu bądź w cegielni.

TEXT.English: Covered Bridge
TEXT.French: Pont couvert
TEXT.Italian: Ponte coperto
TEXT.Polish: Zadaszony Most

TEXT.English: Build a Covered Bridge to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont couvert[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un ponte coperto per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Covered Bridge by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A covered bridge is a timber-truss bridge with a roof and siding which, in most covered bridges, create an almost complete enclosure. The purpose of the covering is to protect the wooden structural members from the weather. Uncovered wooden bridges have a life span of only 10 to 15 years because of the effects of rain and sun.
TEXT.Italian: Un ponte coperto è un ponte di legno con un tetto a capriate e pareti che, nei ponti più coperti, possono creare un involucro quasi completo. Lo scopo del rivestimento è di proteggere gli elementi strutturali di legno dalle intemperie. Ponti di legno scoperti hanno una durata di soli 10 o 15 anni a causa degli effetti della pioggia e del sole.
TEXT.Polish: Most nad kótrym wybudowano zadaszenie.

TEXT.English: Viaduct
TEXT.French: Viaduc
TEXT.Italian: Viadotto
TEXT.Polish: Wiadukt

TEXT.English: Build a Viaduct to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Viaduc[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un Viadotto per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Viaduct by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A viaduct is a bridge composed of several small spans. The term viaduct is derived from the Latin via for road and ducere to lead something. However, the ancient Romans did not use that term per se; it is a modern derivation from an analogy with aqueduct. Like the Roman aqueducts, many early viaducts comprised a series of arches of roughly equal length. Viaducts may span land or water or both.
TEXT.French: A viaduct is a bridge composed of several small spans. The term viaduct is derived from the Latin via for road and ducere to lead something. However, the ancient Romans did not use that term per se; it is a modern derivation from an analogy with aqueduct. Like the Roman aqueducts, many early viaducts comprised a series of arches of roughly equal length. Viaducs may span land or water or both.
TEXT.Italian: Un viadotto è un ponte costituito da numerose arcate. La parola deriva dal latino via ducere, ovvero portare via qualcosa; in ogni caso, questo termine non esisteva presso gli antichi Romani, dato che è una derivazione moderna dall'analogia con gli acquedotti. Come gli acquedotti romani, la maggior parte dei primi viadotti comprendeva una serie di archi di dimensioni simili. I viadotti si espandono sull'acqua, sulla terra o su entrambi.
TEXT.Polish: Wiadukt - budowla pozwalająca na pokonanie przeszkody terenowej typu: dolina, wąwóz lub droga kołowa czy torów kolejowych, z wyłączeniem przeszkód wodnych (do ich pokonania służą mosty), poprzez przejechanie nad nią. Pierwotnie tym terminem była określana droga rzymska przeprowadzona nad wąwozem, na konstrukcji opartej na arkadach. Wiadukty budowane są podobnie jak mosty, z wykorzystaniem podobnych rozwiązań konstrukcyjnych i materiałowych.

TEXT.English: Causeway
TEXT.French: Chaussée
TEXT.Italian: Strada sopraelevata
TEXT.Polish: Grobla Komunikacyjna

TEXT.English: Build a Causeway to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chaussée[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una strada sopraelevata per incrementare il commercio della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Causeway by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: A causeway is a road or railway route across a broad body of water or wetland raised up on an embankment.
